title:
ELEMEN-
TALE GEOMETRICVM, EX EVCLI-
dis Geometria, à Ioanne Vœgelin, Haylpronensi,
ad omnium Mathematicæ studiosorum
utilitatem decerptum.
GERARDVS NOVIOMAGVS
Lectori:
Quid punctum, quid linea, circulus, angulus, orbis
Designet; paucis haec elementa docent.
Sydereos cursus hinc disces; ut venerere
Patrem, qui terras condidit, astra, polos.
title_EN:
ELEMENTARY
GEOMETRY, FROM EUCLID'S
Geometry, extracted by Johannes Vœgelin of Heilbronn,
for the benefit of all students of Mathematics.
GERARDUS NOVIOMAGUS
To the Reader:
What a point, what a line, circle, angle, sphere
Signify; these few elements teach.
From here you will learn the courses of the stars; so that you may revere
The Father, who created the earth, stars, and heavens.

title:
Das erst buch der Geometria.
Ein kurtze unterweisung, was vnd worauff
Geometria gegründet sey, vnd wie man / nach anweisung der selben / mit dem Circkel vnd Richtscheydt / allerley Lini / Flech / vnd Cörper außztheylen / vnd in fürgegebener propozition / machen soll. Aus bewerten leren / gemelter freyen kunst / allen liebhabern der selben / zu einem eingang / vnd allen künstlichen werckleuten zu sonderm nutz vnd vorteyl zusammen gezogen
Durch Wolfgang Schmid Rechen-
meyster zu Bamberg.
Die kunst so im Euclide steet
Gar manchem alzu ser verdeckt
Wirt hie gar leicht und liecht gemacht
Durch dise anleytung / wool betracht.
Getruckt zu Nürnberg.
Mit Röm. Keysl. und König. May.
Privilegio auff VI. Jar.
title_EN:
The First Book of Geometry.
A brief instruction on what and upon what
Geometry is founded, and how one / according to the guidance of the same / with the compass and straightedge / should divide all kinds of lines / surfaces / and bodies / and in a given proposition / should make. Compiled from proven teachings / of the aforementioned liberal art / for all enthusiasts of the same / as an introduction / and for all skilled craftsmen for special use and advantage.
By Wolfgang Schmid, Master of Calculation
in Bamberg.
The art that stands in Euclid
Is far too hidden for many
Here it is made very easy and simple
Through this guidance / well considered.
Printed in Nuremberg.
With Roman Imperial and Royal Majesty's
Privilege for VI years.
PRIVILEGES:
Mit Röm. Keysl. und König. May.
Privilegio auff VI. Jar.
EXPLICIT RECIPIENT: allen liebhabern der selben / zu einem eingang / vnd allen künstlichen werckleuten zu sonderm nutz vnd vorteyl
CONTENT DESC:

title:
Euclidis Megarensis mathematici
clarissimi Elementorum geometricorum libri XV.
Cum expositione Theonis in priores XIII à Bartholomaeo
Veneto Latinitate donata, Campani in omnes, &
Hypsiclis Alexandrini in duos postremos.
His adiecta sunt Phaenomena, Catoptrica & Optica,
deinde Protheoria Marini & Data,
Postremum verò, Opusculum de Levi & Ponderoso,
hactenus non visum, eiusdem auctoris.
title_EN:
The Fifteen Books of the Elements of Geometry by the most illustrious mathematician Euclid of Megara.
With the exposition of Theon on the first thirteen, translated into Latin by Bartholomew of Venice, Campanus on all, & Hypsicles of Alexandria on the last two.
To these are added the Phenomena, Catoptrics & Optics, then the Protheoria of Marinus & the Data,
Finally, the little work on the Light and the Heavy, hitherto unseen, by the same author.
ADDITIONAL CONTENT: His adiecta sunt Phaenomena, Catoptrica & Optica, deinde Protheoria Marini & Data, Postremum verò, Opusculum de Levi & Ponderoso, hactenus non visum, eiusdem auctoris

BY FRANC. PATRICI
BOOKS XV.
In which, with admirable order, and with demonstrations of astonishing ease and strength greater than those used, it is shown that Mathematics
by a Royal way, and more straightforward than
done by the ancients, can
be treated.
To the Most Serene Charles Emmanuel
Duke of Savoy etc.
NOTHING IS DIFFICULT
FOR THE WILLING
PATRON REF:
Al Serenissimo Carlo Emanuele
Duca di Savoia etc.
CONTENT DESC: LIBRI XV.
CONTENT DESC 2:
Ne' quali con mirabile ordine, e con dimostrazioni d'amarauglia più facili, e più forti del le usate, si vede che le Matematiche
per via Regia, e più piana che da
gli antichi fatto non s'è, si
possono trattare.

title:

OU
RECVEIL DE DIVERS
TRAICTEZ MATHEMATIQVES.
A sçauoir ;
D'ARITHMETIQVE, D'ALGEBRE, DE LA
solution de diuers Problemes & questions, tant
Geometriques, qu'Astronomiques.
Conne aussi de plusieurs moyens pour mesurer toutes sortes de
quantitez, soient lignes, superficies & corps.
Item, de la Sphere du monde, auec l'usage & pratique, tant de l'A-
strotable, du Quarré Geometrique, & des Globes, que du
Compas de proportion : Et encore de la construction
des fortifications pratiquées aux pays bas.
Par D. Henrion, Professeur ès Mathematiques.

COLLECTION,
OR
COMPILATION OF VARIOUS
MATHEMATICAL TREATISES.
Namely;
OF ARITHMETIC, ALGEBRA, THE
solution of various Problems & questions, both
Geometric and Astronomical.
Also of several methods to measure all kinds of
quantities, be they lines, surfaces & bodies.
Item, of the Sphere of the world, with the use & practice, both of the As-
trolabe, the Geometric Square, & the Globes, as well as the
Proportional Compass: And also of the construction
of fortifications practiced in the Low Countries.
By D. Henrion, Professor of Mathematics.

Rules of Geometry, & the principal
Maxims & rules of the Arts,
of fortifying & assaulting places.
BASE CONTENT: PARADOXES DE MEYNIER, CONTRE LES MATHEMATICIENS qui abusent la Ieunesse.
EXPLICIT RECIPIENT: Vtiles à ceux qui se veulent seruir proprement des Mathematiques, & de la Philosophie.
ADDITIONAL CONTENT:
Ensemble les Definitions, Theoremes &
Maximes, d’Euclides, d’Archimedes, de Proclus, de Sacrobosco, & d’Aristote, Vtiles à ceux qui se veulent seruir
proprement des Mathematiques, &
de la Philosophie.
ADDITIONAL CONTENT 2:
AVEC VN ABREGE' DES
Reigles de la Geometrie, & des prin-
cipalles Maximes & reigles des Arts, de fortifier & assaillir les places.

title:
ARITHMETIQVE
LOGARITHMETIQVE,
OV
La Construćtion & Vſage des Ta-
bles Logarithmetiques.
Par le moyen deſquelles, multiplication ſe
fait par addition, diuiſion par ſou-
ſtraction, l’extraction de la racine quar-
rée par bipartition, & de la racine cu-
bique par tripartition, &c. Finalement la
regle de trois, & la reſolution des trian-
gles tant rectilignes que ſpheriques par
addition & ſouſtraction.

Gentil-homme Anglois.

title_EN:
ARITHMETIC
LOGARITHMIC,
OR
The Construction & Use of Logarithmic
Tables.
By means of which, multiplication is
done by addition, division by sub-
traction, the extraction of the square root
by bisection, & of the cube root by
trisection, &c. Finally, the
rule of three, & the resolution of
triangles both rectilinear and spherical by
addition & subtraction.
By Edmond Wingate,
English Gentleman.
On the following page you will see the con-
tent of what we have added.

huict pointes, inuenté par Fabrice Mordente,
Mathematicien de feu Alexandre Farnese,
Duc de Parme & de plaisance, &c. Et composé

Oeuure tres-vtile pour tous curieux des Mathematiques qui

des figures Geometriques.
Traduit en François par P. G. S. Mathematicien.
title_EN:
THE
GEOMETRY,
REDUCED
TO AN EASY AND BRIEF
practice, by two excellent instruments,
one of which is the
PANTOMETER OR PROPORTIONAL
COMPASS OF MICHEL CONNETTE,
Engineer of the late Most Serene Archduke Albert,
enriched with eight divisions above the com-
mon & ordinary: The other is
THE USE OF THE COMPASS WITH
eight points, invented by Fabrice Mordente,
Mathematician of the late Alexander Farnese,
Duke of Parma & Piacenza, &c. And composed
in Italian by Michel Connette.
A very useful work for all those curious about Mathematics who
wish to be relieved from the long & tedious description
of Geometric figures.
Translated into French by P. G. S. Mathematician.

title:
MEMOIRES
MATHEMATIQVES,
RECEVILLIS ET DRESSEZ
EN FAVEVR DE LA NOBLESSE
FRANÇOISE,
Par D. HENRION, Mathematicien.
PREMIER VOLUME,
Auquel eſt traité
De l’Arithmetique militaire ; Conſtruction des tables des Sinus,
chanzes & Coupantes ; Doctrine des triangles Recitilignes ; Pratique
de diuers problemes Geometriques ; Dimeſon des lignes droites,
perficies & Corps ; Pratique du Compas de proportion ; ȣ de la
Conſtruction des Fortereſses, ſeruant d’application & augmentacion eſ
deux & troisſiemes Liures des Fortifications de Monſieur Errard.
SECONDE EDITION, reueuë, corrigée & augmentée en diuers en
droicts ; & meſme d'vn traicté entier, contenant vne briefve inconſtr
tion pour conſtruire les fortifications pées aux pays bas.
title_EN:
MEMOIRS
MATHEMATICAL,
COLLECTED AND COMPOSED
IN FAVOR OF THE FRENCH
NOBILITY,
By D. HENRION, Mathematician.
FIRST VOLUME,
In which is discussed
Military Arithmetic; Construction of the tables of Sines,
Chords & Tangents; Doctrine of Right-angled Triangles; Practice
of various Geometric problems; Measurement of straight lines,
surfaces & Solids; Practice of the Proportional Compass; & the
Construction of Fortresses, serving as application & augmentation in
the second & third Books of Fortifications by Monsieur Errard.
SECOND EDITION, revised, corrected & augmented in various
places; and even with an entire treatise, containing a brief instruction
for constructing the fortifications used in the Low Countries.
PATRON REF: EN FAVEVR DE LA NOBLESSE FRANÇOISE,
EDITION INFO: SECONDE EDITION, reueuë, corrigée & augmentée en diuers en droicts ; & meſme d'vn traicté entier, contenant vne briefve inconſtr tion pour conſtruire les fortifications pées aux pays bas.
VERBS: RECEVILLIS ET DRESSEZ, reueuë, corrigée & augmentée

EN FAVEVR DE LA NOBLESSE

deux & troisſiemes Liures des Fortifications de Monſieur Errard.

title:
LA
GEOMETRIE
PRACTIQVE DV
SIEVR BOVLENGER
LECTEVR ORDINAIRE
DV ROY.
OV,
NOVVELLE METHODE DE TOISER ET
Arpenter toutes sortes de grandeurs, sans qu'il soit besoin d'user
de fractions ny de reductions, ny mesme d'aucune diuison : enco-
re que l'on se serue de la mesure ordinaire & de ses parties : Et par
moyen expedianit plus d'operations en vne heure, que l'on n'a-
voit de coustume par cy-deuant de faire en huict.
Oeuvre utile à tous Architectes, Ingenieurs, Maçons, Arpenteurs,
Laigners & autres Geometres.
title_EN:
THE
PRACTICAL GEOMETRY OF
SIEUR BOULENGER
ORDINARY LECTURER
TO THE KING.
OR,
NEW METHOD TO MEASURE AND
Survey all kinds of sizes, without the need to use
fractions or reductions, nor even any division: even
though one uses the ordinary measure & its parts: And by
means accomplishing more operations in one hour, than was
customarily done before in eight.
A useful work for all Architects, Engineers, Masons, Surveyors,
Carpenters & other Geometers.

LA
GEOMETRIE

SIEVR BOVLENGER

title:
ARITHMETIQVE
MEMORIALE.
Par le moyen de laquelle on peut resolu-
dre en son esprit toutes reigles qui con-
cernent le negoce & trafic de toutes
sortes de marchandifes, fans vfer d’au-
cuns chiffres ny Gettons.
En suite de laquelle eſt vne fucincte dioſpofition de
la brieſue Arithmetique auec les gettrons, qui eſt
grandement neceſſaire ä toutes ſortes de perſonnes,
pour reſoudre toutes reigles, auec plus de facilité
&  grande brieueté , que par les formes ordina-
res de l’Arithmetique auec la plume.
Le tout prouiſant de l’inuentiõ du Sieur de la Fon-
taine , l’vn des Gardes de Monſeigneur le Duc de
Longueuille , Gouuerneur & Lieutenant general
pour le Roy en la prouince de Normandie.
title_EN:
ARITHMETIC
MEMORIAL.
By means of which one can solve
in one's mind all rules concerning
the business & trade of all
kinds of merchandise, without using any
figures or Counters.
Following which is a succinct arrangement of
the brief Arithmetic with counters, which is
greatly necessary for all sorts of people,
to solve all rules, with more ease
& greater brevity, than by the ordinary forms
of Arithmetic with the pen.
All provided by the invention of Sieur de la Fon-
taine, one of the Guards of Monseigneur the Duke of
Longueville, Governor & Lieutenant General
for the King in the province of Normandy.
AUTHOR DESCRIPTION: l’vn des Gardes de Monſeigneur le Duc de Longueuille, Gouuerneur & Lieutenant general pour le Roy en la prouince de Normandie.

MEMORIALE.
Par le moyen de laquelle on peut resolu-
dre en son esprit toutes reigles qui con-

cuns chiffres ny Gettons.

Land Surveyors & other Geometers.

title:
LA VRAYE ET
PARFAICTE INSTRV-
ction, dela nouuelle
ARITHMETIQVE
AVX
IETTONS,
APPELLEE LE
GRAND IECT.
Diuisée en trois liures.
I. Comme il faut additionner, soustraire, multiplier, &
diuiser, auec les reductions necessaires pour lesdits re-
gles, soit par liures, sols, ou deniers.
II. Pour calculer toutes sortes de Bordeaux, comme il faut
tirer le marc la liure, les departements des tailles, regles
de Compagnies, & autres, le tout par le marc la liure.
III. La pratique des regles de Trois, sans droite que inuersée,
Composee, les regles de Cents & les Escomptes, &c.
Par IEAN DE POIX Mathematicien.
title_EN:
THE TRUE AND
PERFECT INSTRUC-
tion, of the new
ARITHMETIC
WITH
JETTONS,
CALLED THE
GREAT JECT.
Divided into three books.
I. How to add, subtract, multiply, &
divide, with the necessary reductions for said
rules, whether by pounds, sols, or deniers.
II. To calculate all kinds of Bordeaux, how to
derive the mark per pound, the distribution of taxes, rules
of Companies, & others, all by the mark per pound.
III. The practice of the rules of Three, without direct but inverse,
Composite, the rules of Hundreds & Discounts, &c.
By JEAN DE POIX Mathematician.

title:
LE COVRS
DE
MATHÉMATIQVE,
CONTENANT EN CENT FIGVRES
une idée générale de toutes les parties de cette Science,
l’usage de ses instrumens, diverses manières de prendre les distances,
l’Art d’arpenter, divers moyens de lever & tracer un Plan,
la réduction des Figures par les Triangles de rapport,
la Trigonométrie, les Fortifications régulières & irrégulières,
leurs dehors, profil, élévation, & Sciagraphie.
Contenant de plus un Traité de l’usage du Globe terrestre ;
& un autre de l’Optique Dioptrique & Catoptrique.
DEDIE A LA NOBLESSE,
Par le R. P. Bovrdin, de la Compagnie de Iesvs.
TROISIÈME ÉDITION.
title_EN:
THE COURSE
OF
MATHEMATICS,
CONTAINING IN ONE HUNDRED FIGURES
a general idea of all parts of this Science,
the use of its instruments, various ways to measure distances,
the Art of surveying, different methods to raise & draw a Plan,
the reduction of Figures by the Triangles of proportion,
Trigonometry, regular & irregular Fortifications,
their exteriors, profile, elevation, & Sciagraphy.
Containing moreover a Treatise on the use of the terrestrial Globe;
& another on Dioptric & Catoptric Optics.
DEDICATED TO THE NOBILITY,
By R. P. Bourdin, of the Society of Jesus.
THIRD EDITION.
AUTHOR NAME: Par le R. P. Bovrdin, de la Compagnie de Iesvs.

title:
EVCLIDES ADAVCTVS
ET METHODICVS
MATHEMATICAE UNIVERSALIS
CAROLO EMANVELI II.
SABAVDIAE DVCI PEDEMONTIVM PRINCIPI
REGI CYPRI, &c.
DICATA,
Quae ne dum propositionum dependentiam, sed & rerum ordinem observat. Et complectitur ea omnia, quae de quantitate tum discreta, tum continua abstracta speculari queunt. Rescissis superfluis demonstrationibus, & requisitis omnibus profusè coadunatis.
Singuli quoque Tractatus novis propositionibus aucti sunt, & aliqui etiam ex integro adornati. Omnesque tum figuris, tum verbis clare, dulciloquèque propositi.
AUCTORE
D. GVARINO GVARINO
MVTINENSI C. R. THÉATINO,
Philosofo, Theologo & eiusdem R. C. Mathematico.
title_EN:
EVCLID ADVANCED
AND METHODICAL
UNIVERSAL MATHEMATICS
DEDICATED TO
CARLO EMANUEL II,
DUKE OF SAVOY, PRINCE OF PIEDMONT,
KING OF CYPRUS, &c.
Which not only observes the dependency of propositions, but also the order of things. And encompasses all that can be speculated about quantity, both discrete and continuous, in the abstract. With superfluous demonstrations removed, and all necessary requisites profusely united.
Each Treatise has also been enriched with new propositions, and some even entirely newly adorned. All are clearly and sweetly proposed, both in figures and in words.
BY THE AUTHOR
D. GUARINO GUARINI
OF MODENA, C. R. THEATINE,
Philosopher, Theologian & Mathematician of the same R. C.
BASE CONTENT:
EVCLIDES ADAVCTVS
ET METHODICVS
MATHEMATICAE UNIVERSALIS
AUTHOR DESCRIPTION: MVTINENSI C. R. THÉATINO, Philosofo, Theologo & eiusdem R. C. Mathematico.
PATRON REF:
CAROLO EMANVELI II.
SABAVDIAE DVCI PEDEMONTIVM PRINCIPI
REGI CYPRI, &c.
DICATA,
EDITION INFO:
Quae ne dum propositionum dependentiam, sed & rerum ordinem observat. Et complectitur ea omnia, quae de quantitate tum discreta, tum continua abstracta speculari queunt. Rescissis superfluis demonstrationibus, & requisitis omnibus profusè coadunatis.
Singuli quoque Tractatus novis propositionibus aucti sunt, & aliqui etiam ex integro adornati. Omnesque tum figuris, tum verbis clare, dulciloquèque propositi.
CONTENT DESC:
ET METHODICVS
MATHEMATICAE UNIVERSALIS

title:
EUCLIDES DANICUS,
Bestaende in twee Deelen:
Het eerste Deel: Handeldt van de Meetkonstige
Werckstucken, begrepen in de ses eerste Boecken Euclidis:
Het tweede Deel: Geeft aanleyding om verscheyde
Werckstucken te maecken, als van Snijding, Raecking, Deeling,
Perspectie en Sonnewijssers:
Alleenigh met een Passer te wercken (sonder Rye ofte Liniael te
gebruycken) door Snijding van Roeden.
Voorgesteld
Door
GEORG MOHR.
title_EN:
EUCLIDES DANICUS,
Consisting in two Parts:
The first Part: Deals with the Geometrical
Works, contained in the first six Books of Euclid:
The second Part: Provides guidance to create various
Works, such as Cutting, Touching, Dividing,
Perspective, and Sundials:
Working solely with a Compass (without using a Ruler or Straightedge)
through the Cutting of Rods.
Presented
By
GEORG MOHR.

title:
ELEMENS
DES
MATHEMATIQUES
OU
PRINCIPES GENERAUX
DE
TOUTES LES SCIENCES,
QUI ONT LES GRANDEURS POUR OBJET.
CONTENANT UNE METHODE COURTE ET FACILE
pour comparer ces grandeurs & pour découvrir leurs rapports par le moyen des caractères des nombres, & des lettres de l’alphabet. Dans laquelle les choses sont démontrées selon l’ordre Géométrique, & l’Analyse rendue beaucoup plus facile, & traitée plus à fond que l’on n’a fait jusqu’ici.
title_EN:
ELEMENTS
OF
MATHEMATICS
OR
GENERAL PRINCIPLES
OF
ALL THE SCIENCES,
WHICH HAVE MAGNITUDES AS THEIR OBJECT.
CONTAINING A SHORT AND EASY METHOD
to compare these magnitudes & to discover their relationships by means of the characters of numbers, & the letters of the alphabet. In which things are demonstrated according to the Geometric order, & Analysis made much easier, & treated more thoroughly than has been done until now.
CONTENT DESC:
OU
PRINCIPES GENERAUX
DE
TOUTES LES SCIENCES, QUI ONT LES GRANDEURS POUR OBJET.
ADDITIONAL CONTENT:
CONTENANT UNE METHODE COURTE ET FACILE
pour comparer ces grandeurs & pour découvrir leurs rapports par le moyen des caractères des nombres, & des lettres de l’alphabet.

title:
NOUVEAUX ELEMENS
DE
GEOMETRIE,
CONTENANT,
Outre un ordre tout nouveau, & de nouvelles démonstrations des Propositions les plus communes,
De nouveaux moyens de faire voir quelles Lignes sont incommensurables :
De nouvelles mesures des Angles, dont on ne s’étoit point encore avisé :
Et de nouvelles manières de trouver & de démontrer la proportion des Lignes.
SECONDE EDITION.
Où il y a un Traité tout nouveau des Proportions, & beaucoup d’autres changements considérables.
title_EN:
NEW ELEMENTS
OF
GEOMETRY,
CONTAINING,
Besides an entirely new order, & new demonstrations of the most common Propositions,
New means to show which Lines are incommensurable:
New measures of Angles, which had not yet been devised:
And new ways to find & demonstrate the proportion of Lines.
SECOND EDITION.
Where there is an entirely new Treatise on Proportions, & many other considerable changes.
EDITION INFO: SECONDE EDITION. Où il y a un Traité tout nouveau des Proportions, & beaucoup d’autres changements considérables.
CONTENT DESC:
CONTENANT, Outre un ordre tout nouveau, & de nouvelles démonstrations des Propositions les plus communes, De nouveaux moyens de faire voir quelles Lignes sont incommensurables :
De nouvelles mesures des Angles, dont on ne s’étoit point encore avisé :
Et de nouvelles manières de trouver & de démontrer la proportion des Lignes.
ADDITIONAL CONTENT: Où il y a un Traité tout nouveau des Proportions, & beaucoup d’autres changements considérables.

title:
[Vol. 1] NOUVEAUX ELEMENS
DES
MATHEMATIQUES
OU
PRINCIPES GENERAUX
DE
TOUTES LES SCIENCES
Qui ont les grandeurs pour objet.
SECONDE EDITION, PLUS AMPLE ET MIEUX DIGEREE.
PREMIER VOLUME
Qui comprend la science des Nombres & l'Algèbre, ou l'art de comparer toute sorte de grandeurs par le moyen des chiffres & des lettres.
Et où tout est démontré dans un ordre naturel & facile, & les choses expliquées plus à fond, & poussées plus loin que l’on n’a fait jusqu’ici.
Par JEAN PRESTET, Prêtre, ci-devant Professeur des Mathématiques dans les Universitez d’Angers & de Nantes.
[Vol. 2] NOUVEAUX ELEMENS
DES
MATHEMATIQUES
OU
PRINCIPES GENERAUX
DE
TOUTES LES SCIENCES
Qui ont les grandeurs pour objet.
SECOND VOLUME
Qui comprend un corps d’Analyse, ou l’art de résoudre les Questions qu’on propose sur toutes les diverses grandeurs.
Et où tout est expliqué dans un ordre naturel & facile, & les choses traitées bien plus à fond, & poussées plus loin que l’on n’a fait jusqu’ici.
Par JEAN PRESTET, Prêtre, ci-devant Professeur des Mathématiques dans les Universitez d’Angers & de Nantes.
title_EN:
[Vol. 1] NEW ELEMENTS
OF
MATHEMATICS
OR
GENERAL PRINCIPLES
OF
ALL THE SCIENCES
That have magnitudes as their object.
SECOND EDITION, MORE EXTENSIVE AND BETTER ORGANIZED.
FIRST VOLUME
Which includes the science of Numbers & Algebra, or the art of comparing all kinds of magnitudes by means of numbers & letters.
And where everything is demonstrated in a natural & easy order, & things are explained more thoroughly, & pushed further than has been done until now.
By JEAN PRESTET, Priest, formerly Professor of Mathematics at the Universities of Angers & Nantes.
[Vol. 2] NEW ELEMENTS
OF
MATHEMATICS
OR
GENERAL PRINCIPLES
OF
ALL THE SCIENCES
That have magnitudes as their object.
SECOND VOLUME
Which includes a body of Analysis, or the art of solving the Questions proposed on all the various magnitudes.
And where everything is explained in a natural & easy order, & things are treated much more thoroughly, & pushed further than has been done until now.
By JEAN PRESTET, Priest, formerly Professor of Mathematics at the Universities of Angers & Nantes.

title:
ANITII MANLII SEVERINI BOETHI IN OMNIBVS PHILO-
SOPHIAE PARTIBVS INTER LAtinos & Græcos autores principis OPERA, quæ extant, omnia, non solum liberalium disciplinarum, sed maiorum facultatum studiosis etiam utilissima. sine quibus Aristoteles in præcipuis locis intellegi non potest. Quare summi uiri rectè censebant, uerè studiosum non esse in cuius bibliotheca hic autor non erat. Porrò, infinitis locis non aliquot uoces, sed longas periodos quæ in prioribus æditionibus desiderabantur, emendauimus, adiuti praesidio uetustissimorum manuscriptorum exemplarium, & auxilio doctissimorum uirorum: Inter quos in omni literarum genere summus uir HENRICHVS LORITVS GLAREANVS Arithmeticam & Musicam demonstrationibus & figuris auctiorem redditam suo pristino nitori restituit, cui exemplar aureum uenerandæque uetustatis fuit ex monasterio S. Georgij. Et MARTIANVS ROTA opus de tota differendi ratione, hoc est, organum, Dialecticæ & Rhetoricæ studiosis necessarium, illustrauit. Et huius autoris uitam certis coniecturis, cum ex alijs, tum ex Boëthi monumentis collectam, bona fide descripsit.
title_EN: THE WORKS OF ANICIUS MANLIUS SEVERINUS BOETHIUS, THE FOREMOST AUTHOR IN ALL PARTS OF PHILOSOPHY AMONG LATIN AND GREEK AUTHORS, which are extant, all of them, not only most useful to students of the liberal disciplines, but also to those of the higher faculties. Without which, Aristotle cannot be understood in the principal places. Therefore, the greatest men rightly judged that one was not truly a student in whose library this author was not present. Furthermore, in countless places, we have corrected not just some words, but long periods that were missing in previous editions, aided by the support of the oldest manuscript copies, and the assistance of the most learned men: Among whom, in every kind of literature, the greatest man HENRICHUS LORITUS GLAREANUS restored Arithmetic and Music, made more complete with demonstrations and figures, to their former splendor, for which an exemplar of golden and venerable antiquity was from the monastery of St. George. And MARTIANUS ROTA illustrated the work on the entire method of differentiating, that is, the organ, necessary for students of Dialectic and Rhetoric. And he faithfully described the life of this author, collected with certain conjectures, both from others and from Boethius's own monuments.
OTHER NAMES: Aristoteles, HENRICHVS LORITVS GLAREANVS, MARTIANVS ROTA
EDITION INFO: Porrò, infinitis locis non aliquot uoces, sed longas periodos quæ in prioribus æditionibus desiderabantur, emendauimus, adiuti praesidio uetustissimorum manuscriptorum exemplarium, & auxilio doctissimorum uirorum
EXPLICIT RECIPIENT 2: uerè studiosum non esse in cuius bibliotheca hic autor non erat
EXPLICIT RECIPIENT: non solum liberalium disciplinarum, sed maiorum facultatum studiosis etiam utilissima

title:
ANITII MANLII SEVERINI BOETHI, PHILOSOPHORVM
ET THEOLOGORVM PRINCIPIS OPERA omnia, quorum alia antè impressa, nunc denuò per doctos uiros recognita: alia, quæ hactenus latuerunt, nunc primùm emendatiss. in lucem prodeunt. In quibus præter uniuersæ philosophiæ exactissimam doctrinam, pluri-morum in diuinis mysteriorum, & diiciliorum locorum in Platone, Aristotele alijsque Græcis & Latinis autoribus luculentissimæ expli-cationes reperiuntur. PRAETEREA IAM ACCESSERVNT, Ioannis Murmelij in v. Lib. De Consolatione Philosophiæ commentaria. Et in eosdem Rodolphi Agricolæ Enarrationes. Item, Gilberti Porretæ, Episcopi Pictauiensis in IIII. Lib. de Trinitate commentarij, antè nun-quam æditi.  Præter reliquos doctiss. uiros, HENRICVS LORITVS
GLAREANVS, Arithmeticam & Musicam demonstrationibus & figuris auctiorem redditam, suo pristino nitori restituit: Cui exemplar aureum uenerandæque uetustatis fuit ex monasterio S. Georgij. Et MAR-TIANVS ROTA, opus de tota differendi ratione, hoc est, organum, Dialecticæ & Rhetoricæ studiosis necessarium, illustrauit. Et huius autoris uitam, cùm ex alijs, tum ex Boëthi munumentis collectam, bona fide descripsit.
title_EN:
THE COMPLETE WORKS OF ANICIUS MANLIUS SEVERINUS BOETHIUS, PRINCE OF PHILOSOPHERS
AND THEOLOGIANS, some of which were previously printed, now newly reviewed by learned men: others, which have remained hidden until now, are now for the first time published in a most corrected form. In which, besides the most exact doctrine of universal philosophy, the most splendid explanations of many divine mysteries, and the more difficult passages in Plato, Aristotle, and other Greek and Latin authors are found. FURTHERMORE, THERE HAVE NOW BEEN ADDED, the commentaries of Johannes Murmelius on the five books of The Consolation of Philosophy. And the Explanations on the same by Rodolphus Agricola. Also, the commentaries of Gilbert Porreta, Bishop of Poitiers, on the four books on the Trinity, never before published. Besides other most learned men, HENRICUS LORITUS
GLAREANUS, has restored Arithmetic and Music, made more complete with demonstrations and figures, to their former splendor: For whom a golden example of venerable antiquity was from the monastery of St. George. And MARTIANUS ROTA, has illustrated the work on the entire method of differentiating, that is, the organ, necessary for students of Dialectics and Rhetoric. And he has faithfully described the life of this author, collected from both other sources and Boethius's own monuments.
OTHER NAMES: Platone, Aristotele, Ioannis Murmelij, Rodolphi Agricolæ, Gilberti Porretæ, HENRICVS LORITVS GLAREANVS, MAR-TIANVS ROTA
EDITION INFO: alia antè impressa, nunc denuò per doctos uiros recognita: alia, quæ hactenus latuerunt, nunc primùm emendatiss. in lucem prodeunt.
EXPLICITLY STATED: TRANSLATED FROM: in Platone, Aristotele alijsque Græcis & Latinis autoribus
EXPLICIT RECIPIENT: Dialecticæ & Rhetoricæ studiosis

title:
NOVA REPERTA
GEOMETRICA
IOHANNIS ALFONSI
MOLINENSIS CANI,

In quibus subtiliores Geometricae quaestiones de
Duplicatione Cubi, Quadratura circuli, Rectitudine angulorum, Aequalitate linearum curvarum cum recta discutientur: Demonstrationibus firmissimis fulciuntur: indeque aurea corollaria Geometricarum subtilitatum deducuntur: Euclidea Elementa nonnulla corriguntur, nonnulla ut falsa reijciuntur.

Hispanice edita, jam vero latinitate donata
a
NICOLAO IANSONIO
Arnh. Geldro.
title_EN:
NEW DISCOVERIES
GEOMETRICA
OF JOHANNES ALFONSI
OF MOLINA,

In which the more subtle questions of Geometry concerning
the Duplication of the Cube, the Quadrature of the Circle, the Straightness of Angles, the Equality of Curved Lines with the Straight are discussed: They are supported by very strong demonstrations: and from there golden corollaries of Geometric subtleties are deduced: Some Euclidean Elements are corrected, some are rejected as false.

Originally published in Spanish, now rendered into Latin
by
NICOLAS JANSON
Arnh. Geldro.
EDITION INFO: Euclidea Elementa nonnulla corriguntur, nonnulla ut falsa reijciuntur.
ADDITIONAL CONTENT: Euclidea Elementa nonnulla corriguntur, nonnulla ut falsa reijciuntur

title:
ΕΥΚΛΕΙΔΟΥ ΔΕΔΟΜΕΝΑ. ΚΑΙ ΜΑΡΙΝΟΥ ΦΙΛΟΣΟΦΟΥ ΕΙΣ ΔΕΔΟΜΕΝΑ ΕΥΚΛΕΙΔΟΥ ΥΠΟΜΝΗΜΑ. EVCLIDIS
DATA. OPVS AD VETERVM GEOMETRIÆ Autorum Archimedis, Apollonij, Pappi, Eutocij, cæterorúmque non modo lectionem, sed ad Geometricæ quoque Analyseos instaurationem planè necessar-ium, & à multis diu desideratum. CLAVDIVS HARDY SEBAST. FIL. in supremâ Parisiensi Curiâ Aduocatus, è Regis Christianissimi Bibliothecâ Græcè nunc primùm edidit, Latinè vertit, scholijsq; illus-trauit. Adiectus est ex eadem Bibliothecâ MARINI PHILOSOPHI Commentarius Græcè & Latinè, quo Dati natura, Datorúmque Eu-clideorum vtilitates explicantur.
title_EN:
EUCLID'S DATA. AND MARINUS THE PHILOSOPHER'S COMMENTARY ON EUCLID'S DATA. EUCLID'S
DATA. A WORK ESSENTIAL NOT ONLY FOR THE READING OF THE ANCIENT GEOMETRY AUTHORS ARCHIMEDES, APOLLONIUS, PAPPUS, EUTOCIUS, AND OTHERS, BUT ALSO FOR THE RESTORATION OF GEOMETRIC ANALYSIS, LONG DESIRED BY MANY. CLAUDIUS HARDY, SON OF SEBASTIAN, ADVOCATE IN THE SUPREME PARISIAN COURT, HAS NOW FOR THE FIRST TIME PUBLISHED IT IN GREEK FROM THE LIBRARY OF THE MOST CHRISTIAN KING, TRANSLATED IT INTO LATIN, AND ILLUSTRATED IT WITH NOTES. APPENDED IS THE COMMENTARY OF MARINUS THE PHILOSOPHER FROM THE SAME LIBRARY IN GREEK AND LATIN, IN WHICH THE NATURE OF THE GIVEN AND THE USES OF EUCLID'S DATA ARE EXPLAINED.
AUTHOR DESCRIPTION: in supremâ Parisiensi Curiâ Aduocatus, è Regis Christianissimi Bibliothecâ Græcè nunc primùm edidit, Latinè vertit, scholijsq; illus-trauit.

SIMVLQVE TRADITVR METHODVS

title:
TRACTATUS
DE
PROPORTIONE
HARMONICA.

IN QVO PLVRIMA PROBLEMATA,
hactenus non soluta in serie trium quantitatum
Harmonice proportionalium resoluuntur tum
Algebricè, tum Canonicè, tum etiam Geometricè,

ADICITVR APPENDIX,
In qua resoluuntur Problemata in serie quatuor, quinque,
sex, imò & quotcunque quantitatum continuè
harmonice proportionalium.
title_EN:
TREATISE
ON
HARMONIC
PROPORTION.

In which many problems,
hitherto unsolved in the series of three quantities
harmonically proportional, are resolved
both Algebraically, Canonically, and also Geometrically,

With an added Appendix,
in which problems are solved in series of four, five,
six, and indeed of however many quantities
continuously harmonically proportional.

GEOMETRA
SIVE
OPVS CONTEXTVM
EX ARITHMETICA ET GEOMETRIA
simul; in quo Quaestiones omnes Diophanti, quae

tum Geometricis rationibus.

ADIECTVS EST
DIOPHANTVS GEOMETRA PROMOTVS,
in quo subtiles Propositiones non absimili methodo pertractan-
tur, & via nova ad eiusmodi praxes inveniendas aperitur.

Authore P. IACOBO DE BILLY, Societatis
IESV Sacerdote.
title_EN:
DIOPHANTUS
THE GEOMETER
OR
A WORK COMPOSED
FROM ARITHMETIC AND GEOMETRY
together; in which all the questions of Diophantus that
can be solved geometrically are explained both by
algebraic and by geometric reasoning.

ADDED IS
DIOPHANTUS THE GEOMETER ADVANCED,
in which subtle propositions are treated by a similar method,
and a new way is opened for discovering practices of this kind.

By Father Jacques de Billy,
Priest of the Society of Jesus.

PARISIIS,

title:

ASTRONOMICVM
IN QVO
Siderum omnium hypotheses, eorum motus tum
medij, tum veri, Tabularum condendarum
ratio, eclipsium putandarum methodus, ob-
servationum praxes, caeterorumque omnium
quae ab astronomis pertractantur, scientificus

AVCTORE
P. IACOBO DE BILLY, Societatis IESV
Compendiensi.
title_EN:
ASTRONOMICAL WORK
In which
the hypotheses of all the stars, their motions both
mean and true, the method of constructing tables,
the way of predicting eclipses, the practices of
observations, and all other matters
handled by astronomers, are set forth
with scientific calculation, in a brief and easy manner.

By
Father Jacques de Billy, of the Society of Jesus,
of Compiègne.

title:
TRAITÉ
DES MANIERES
DE DESSINER LES ORDRES
DE L’ARCHITECTVRE ANTIQVE
EN TOVTES LEVRS PARTIES.

Avec plusieurs belles Particularitez qui n’ont point
paru jusques à present touchant les Bastimens Marquez.

Comme,
La NATURELLE Entreveüitte des gros et menüs
Membres de leurs Degrés, ou Escaliers.
Puis,
Le MOYEN d’arrester par Dessein et Modelle
en petit, les parties d’un Edifice, en sorte
qu’autant Executé en grand, il fasse l’effet
que l’on s’est proposé.
Et enfin,
La PRATIQUE de trouver la place Geometral des
jours Ombres et Ombreages, sur le corps Geometral.

Par A. BOSSE.
title_EN:
TREATISE
ON THE METHODS
OF DRAWING THE ORDERS
OF ANCIENT ARCHITECTURE
IN ALL THEIR PARTS.

With several fine details that have not until now
appeared concerning notable buildings.

Such as:
The NATURAL interweaving of the large and small
members of their steps or staircases.
Then,
The METHOD of fixing by drawing and model
in small scale, the parts of a building, in such
a way that, when executed in large, it produces
the intended effect.
And finally,
The PRACTICE of finding the geometrical place of
lights, shadows, and shading, on the geometrical body.

By A. Bosse.
imprint:

title:
ISMAELIS BVLLIALDI
ASTRONOMIA
PHILOLAICA.
OPVS NOVVM,

In quo motus Planetarum per novam ac veram Hypothesim demon-
strantur. Medique motus, aliquot observationum auctoritate,
ex Manuscripto Bibliothecæ Regiæ quæ hactenus omnibus
Astronomis ignotæ fuerunt, stabilientur.

Superque illa Hypothesi TABULÆ constructæ omnium,
quotquot hactenus editæ sunt, facillimæ.

ADDITA EST NOVA METHODVS CUIVS OPE
Eclipses Solare, absque ullâ solutione triangulorum Sphaericorum ad Parallaxes
inuestigandas, expeditissime computantur.

HISTORIA ORTVS ET PROGRESSVS ASTRONOMIÆ
in Prolegomenis describitur, & breviter recensentur ea, quæ
in hoc opere nunc primum prodeunt.
title_EN:
ISMAËL BULLIALDUS
PHILOLAIC
ASTRONOMY.
A NEW WORK,

In which the motions of the planets are demonstrated
according to a new and true hypothesis.
And mean motions, confirmed by the authority of certain observations
from a manuscript of the Royal Library,
hitherto unknown to all astronomers, are established.

Moreover, tables are constructed on this hypothesis
for all [the planetary motions], easier than any previously published.

ADDED IS A NEW METHOD, BY WHICH
solar eclipses, without any solution of spherical triangles for finding parallaxes,
are computed most expeditiously.

THE HISTORY OF THE ORIGIN AND PROGRESS OF ASTRONOMY
is described in the Prolegomena,
and those things are briefly recounted which
in this work now appear for the first time.

perficies & Corps ; Pratique du Compas de proportions ; & de la
Conſtruction des Fortereſſes, ſeruans d’explication & augmentation és
deux & troiſieſmes Liures des Fortifications de Monſieur Errard.

SECONDE EDITION, reueuë, corrigée & augmentée en diuers en-
droicts, & meſme d’vn traicté entier, co[n]tenant vne brieue inſtru-
ction pour conſtruire les fortifications pratiquées aux pays bas.
title_EN:
MATHEMATICAL
MEMOIRS,
COLLECTED AND COMPOSED
IN FAVOR OF THE FRENCH NOBILITY.

By D. Henrion, Mathematician.

FIRST VOLUME,
In which is treated:

Military arithmetic; construction of tables of sines, tangents,
and secants; doctrine of right-angled triangles; practice
of various geometrical problems; measurement of straight lines,
surfaces and solids; practice with the proportional compass; and
the construction of fortresses, serving as explanation and augmentation
to the second and third books of the Fortifications of Monsieur Errard.

SECOND EDITION, revised, corrected and augmented in various
places, and even with an entire treatise, containing a brief instruction
for constructing the fortifications practiced in the Low Countries.

or onto the ground such figures and fortifications as one
wishes; make all sorts of maps, both geographic
and chorographic; and perform all
other operations of arithmetic and geometry
which are practiced with the proportional compass,
the proportional rule, the graphometer, and the compass.

By D. Henrion, Mathematician.

title:

title:
LA
PERSPECTIVE
CVRIEVSE
OV
MAGIE ARTIFICIELE
DES EFFETS MERVEILLEVX.

De
{ L’Optique, par la vision directe.
{ La Catoptrique, par la reflexion des miroirs
  plats, Cylindriques & Coniques.
{ La Dioptrique, par la refraction des Crystaux.

Dans laquelle, outre un abbrégé & methode generale de la Perspective commu-
ne, reduite en pratique sur les cinq corps reguliers, est encore enseignée la façon
de faire & construire toutes sortes de figures difformes, qui estant veues de
leur point paroissent dans une juste proportion : le tout par des pratiques
si familières, que les moins versez en la Geometrie s’en pourront servir avec
le seul compas & la regle.

Καὶ Ἀγεωμέτρητος εἰσίτω.

Oeuvre tres-vtile aux Peintres, Architectes, Graveurs, Sculpteurs, & à tous autres
qui se servent du dessein en leurs ouvrages.

Par le Pere F. IEAN FRANÇOIS NICERON Parisien de l’Ordre des Minimes.
title_EN:
THE
CURIOUS PERSPECTIVE
OR
ARTIFICIAL MAGIC
OF MARVELOUS EFFECTS.

Of
{ Optics, by direct vision.
{ Catoptrics, by the reflection of mirrors
  flat, cylindrical, and conical.
{ Dioptrics, by the refraction of crystals.

In which, besides a summary and general method of common Perspective,
reduced to practice upon the five regular bodies, there is also taught the way
to make and construct all sorts of deformed figures, which when viewed from
their proper point appear in correct proportion: all by practices
so easy, that even the least versed in Geometry may use them with
only the compass and the ruler.

“Let no one ignorant of geometry enter here.”

A work most useful for Painters, Architects, Engravers, Sculptors, and all others
who employ drawing in their works.

By Father Jean François Niceron, Parisian, of the Order of Minims.

title:
R. P.
IOANNIS FRANCISCI
NICERONIS
PARISINI, EX ORD. MINIM.

THAVMATVRGVS
OPTICVS,
SEV
ADMIRANDA

OPTICES, per radium directum:
CATOPTRICES, per reflexum è politis corporibus, planis, cylindricis,
conicis, polyedris, polygonis & aliis:
DIOPTRICES, per refractionem in diaphanis.

In quibus praeter Scenographiae seu Perspectivae communis fundamenta, praxes facillimas &
demonstrationes, exhibita etiam ex illius praescripto omnis generis solida regularia sim-
plicia & composita, & irregularia multiformia, polyedra, stellata, perforata, nec non
Architecturae simulacra, militaris diagrammata, & alia in graphide spectacula non innumera:
certissimae quoque & expedissimae dantur regulae, pro triplici videndi ratione directa,
reflexa & refracta, figuram cujuscumque deformes & improportionatas in quae-
cunq; superficie delineandi, ut ea ex certo spectatae puncto videantur venustè proportio-
natae, picturaeque & symmetriae legibus non dissone; imo & cuicunque objecto dato simillimae.

Opus curiosum & utile Pictoribus, Architectis, Statuariis, Sculptoribus, Caelatoribus, & qui-
buscumque aliis, quorum opera in delineandi studio posita est.

PARS PRIMA
De iis quae spectant ad Visionem Directam.

AD EMINentissimum CARDINALEM
MAZARINVM.
title_EN:
THE REVEREND FATHER
JEAN-FRANÇOIS
NICERON,
PARISIAN, OF THE ORDER OF MINIMS.

THE OPTICAL
THAUMATURGE,
OR
WONDERS

OF OPTICS, by direct rays;
OF CATOPTRICS, by reflection from polished bodies, plane, cylindrical,
conical, polyhedral, polygonal, and others;
OF DIOPTRICS, by refraction in transparent bodies.

In which, besides the foundations of scenography or common perspective, very easy
practices and demonstrations are shown, as well as prescriptions for all kinds of
regular solids, simple and composite, and irregular multiform ones, polyhedra,
star-shaped, perforated, and also architectural models, military diagrams, and countless
other spectacles in drawing: together with the surest and most expeditious rules, for the
three modes of vision — direct, reflected, and refracted — for delineating figures of
whatever deformed and disproportioned shapes upon any surface, so that when viewed
from a fixed point they appear proportioned, pleasing, and consistent with the laws of
painting and symmetry; indeed, even most similar to any given object.

A curious and useful work for Painters, Architects, Sculptors, Engravers, and all
others whose work lies in the study of drawing.

PART ONE
On those things which concern Direct Vision.

TO THE MOST EMINENT CARDINAL
MAZARIN.

title:
LA CONSTRVCTION,

DV
QVADRANT NOVVEAV

ment par vn seul maxime:

REFVTATION
DV LIBELLE DE I. PVJOS,
INTITVLE’

QVADRATRICE DV MESME PVJOS.

TROISIESME REFVTATION
de la fausse quadrature de Mr de Laleu, où il est

title_EN:

imprint: M. DC. XXXXIII.

title:
REFVTATION
D’vn Libelle imprimé à Roüen en l’année 1642.
sous le titre de

FVUTILITEZ DES RAISONNEMENS, &c.

Où il est monstré comme il a esté fait au sujet d’vn autre
Libelle envoyé de Lyon, intitulé

NVLLITE’ DES DEMONSTRATIONS, &c.

Qules pretenduës FVUTILITEZ, tout aussi bien que les pre-
tenduës NVLLITEZ, mises en avant pour surprendre les moins
rusez, par I. Pujos, qui se dit Auteur de ces deux Libelles,
apres auoir pourtant auoué expressement ce dont il estoit, &
deuoit seulement estre question, à sçauoir, LA FAVSSETE’
des pretenduës QVADRATVRES DV CERCLE, & DV-
PLICATION DV CVBE, DV SIEVR DE LALEV SON
MAISTRE, ne sont en effet que ce que le mesme Pujos n’a
peu apperceuoir & penetrer, quoy que tres-facile & trivial,
pour auoir l’esprit petit & tardif à bien comprendre, comme il est re-
connu par escrit publiquement, il y a dix ans passez. Outre
qu’elles contiennent six ou sept signalées FAVSSETEZ, co-
tées par le menu en la page suivante, refutées en ce Liuret, au-
quel par mesme moyen pour

TROISIEME REFVTATION

De la fausse Quadrature du Cercle du SIEVR DE LALEV, si souvent
agitée depuis vingt-quatre ans, il est demonstré que le QVARRE des
huict neufuiesmes du diametre d’vn cercle est plus grand que la figure de XXIIJ
costez circonscrite au mesme cercle. Et d’abondant, que le quarré de la ligne (que
I. Pujos declare estre celle dont les lignes 7, 8, 9 & 10 de la page, du li-
ure intitulé, Quadrature du Cercle & Double du Cube, imprimé & resouë par
P. de V, imprimé à la Rochelle en l’an 1619, doivent estre entendues),
est plus grand que la figure de XXXII costez, circonscrite à un cercle.
title_EN:
REFUTATION
Of a pamphlet printed in Rouen in the year 1642,
under the title of

FUTILITY OF REASONINGS, etc.

Where it is shown how it was made on the subject of another
pamphlet sent from Lyon, entitled

NULLITY OF DEMONSTRATIONS, etc.

The so-called FUTILITIES, as well as the so-called
NULLITIES, put forward to deceive the less
wary, by J. Pujos, who claims to be the Author of these two pamphlets,
after having indeed expressly admitted what it was, and
what should have been solely in question, namely, THE FALSEHOOD
of the so-called QUADRATURES OF THE CIRCLE, and the
DUPLICATION OF THE CUBE, of the SIEUR DE LALEU HIS
MASTER, are in fact nothing but what the same Pujos failed
to notice and understand, although very easy and trivial,
because of his small and slow wit in comprehending, as was
publicly recognized in writing, ten years ago. Moreover,
they contain six or seven marked FALSEHOODS,
set forth in detail on the following page, refuted in this booklet, by
the same method for the

THIRD REFUTATION

Of the false Quadrature of the Circle of the SIEUR DE LALEU, so often
debated for twenty-four years, it is demonstrated that the SQUARE of
eight-ninths of the diameter of a circle is larger than the figure of 23
sides inscribed in the same circle. And moreover, that the square of the line (which
J. Pujos declares to be that which lines 7, 8, 9 & 10 of the page, of the book
entitled, Quadrature of the Circle and Doubling of the Cube, printed and reissued by
P. de V, printed in La Rochelle in the year 1619, should be understood),
is larger than the figure of 32 sides inscribed in a circle.

title:
SOLVTIO
DVORVM PROBLEMATVM
circa numeros cubos & quadratos, quae tan
quam insolubilia vniversis Europae Mathe
maticis a clarissimo Viro D. Fermat sunt pro
posita, & ad D. Cl. M. Laurenderium
Doctorem Medicum transmissa.

A D. B. F. D. B. INVENTA.

NEC NON.
Alia duo Problemata numerica a D. Cl. M. Laurenderio Vicissim
proposita, cum quibusdam solutionibus ab eodem
D. B. F. D. B. datis.

HIS ACCESSIT.
Inquisitio in solutionem prioris Problematis a D. Francisco à Schooten
in Academia Lugduno Batava Matheseos Professore datam.

IN QVA CONTINENTVR:
Sex aliae solutiones prioris Problematis terminis Analyticis ab eodem
D. B. F. sub forma Problematis datae.

INSVPER ET
Solutio alterius Problematis ab eodem Cl. viro D. Fermat circa numeros
unitate à quadrato deficientes proposita, cum ipsius solutionis constructione.
title_EN:
Solution of Two Problems
concerning cubic and square numbers, which, as insoluble, were proposed to all the mathematicians of Europe by the most illustrious man, M. Fermat, and transmitted to the very distinguished Dr. M. Laurender, physician.

Discovered by D.B.F.D.B.

And also: Two other numerical problems, proposed in turn by the very distinguished Dr. M. Laurender, together with certain solutions given by the same D.B.F.D.B.

Added to this: An inquiry into the solution of the first problem, given by Mr. Frans van Schooten, Professor of Mathematics at the University of Leiden.

In which are contained: Six other solutions of the first problem in analytical terms, given in the form of a problem by the same D.B.F.

Furthermore also: The solution of another problem proposed by the same illustrious M. Fermat concerning numbers deficient by one from a square, with a construction of its solution.

title:
A GEOMETRICAL
Practise, named PANTOMETRIA,
diuided into three Bookes, Longimetra,
Planimetra and Stereometria, containing Rules manifolde
for mensuration of all lines, Superficies and Solides: with
sundry strange conclusions both by instrument
and without, and also by perspectiue glasses, to
set forth the true description or exact plat of
any whole Region: framed by Leonard
Digges Gentleman, lately finished
by Thomas Digges his
sonne.

Who hathe also thereunto adioyned a Mathematicall treatise of
the fiue regulare Platonical solides, and their Metamorphosis
or transformation into fiue other equilater and uniforme
solides Geometricall, of his owne inuention, hitherto not mentioned of by any geometricians.
title_EN:
A Geometrical Practice, called Pantometria,
divided into three books: Longimetry, Planimetry, and Stereometry, containing manifold rules for the measurement of all lines, surfaces, and solids, together with sundry curious conclusions, both by instruments and without; and also by perspective glasses, to set forth the true description or exact map of any whole region. First framed by Leonard Digges, Gentleman, and lately completed by his son, Thomas Digges.

Who has also added a mathematical treatise of the five regular Platonic solids, and their metamorphosis or transformation into five other equilateral and uniform geometrical solids of his own invention, not hitherto mentioned by any geometricians.

title:
CONTENTA.

EVCLIDIS Megarensis Geometricorum elemento
rum libri XV.

CAMPANI Galli trāslāpini in eosdem commentario
rum libri XV.

THEONIS Alexandrini Bartholamaeo Zamberto
Veneto interprete, in tredecim priores, commentario
rum libri XIII.

HYPSICLIS Alexandrini in duos posteriores, eodē
Bartholamaeo Zamberto Veneto interprete, comme
ntariorum libri II.

VT CUNQVE NOSTER VALVIT LABOR
conciliata sunt hæc omnia, ad studiosorum non par
uam (quam optamus) utilitatem: id Magnifico
D. FRANCISCO Briconneto postulante.
Si hæc benevole suscipiantur, & fructum
adferant quem cupimus: alia eiusdem au
thoris opera prodiibunt in lucem,
succēssum præstante deo, &
adiutoribus (vbivbi ge
ntiu sint) ad bonarum
literarum institui
tione pro
be affe
ctis
Gallis, Italīs, Germanīs, Hispaniīs, Anglis, quibus
omnibus prospera imprecāmur: & puram
pro dignitate veramqꝫ co
gnitionis lucem.
title_EN:
Contents.

Euclid of Megara, the Elements of Geometry, 15 books.

Campanus of Novara, the Gallicus, commentary on the same, 15 books.

Theon of Alexandria, in the first thirteen books, with commentary, translated by Bartholomeo Zamberti of Venice, 13 books.

Hypsicles of Alexandria, on the last two books, with commentary, by the same Bartholomeo Zamberti of Venice, 2 books.

However far our labor has availed,
all these have been brought together for no small benefit (as we hope) of students: at the request of the Magnificent Lord François Briconnet.
If these are received kindly, and bring forth the fruit we desire, other works of the same author will appear in print, with God granting success, and with the help of those wherever they may be, who are well disposed toward the advancement of good letters—
among the French, Italians, Germans, Spaniards, English, to all of whom we wish prosperity, and the pure and genuine light of true knowledge in accordance with dignity.

title:
GEOMETRIA
PRATTICA

TRATTA Dagli Elementi d’Euclide
et altri Autori
Da Giovanni Pomodoro Venetiano
Mathematico eccellentissimo descritta
et Dichiarata da Giovanni Scala Mathematico.

Nella quale si vede in 150. Tavole di Rame (sol
tanto quelle che ad un buon Geometra s’ap
partiene di sapere et porre in uso).

Opera non meno Vtile che necessaria, à Misuratori di
terreni, di fabriche, et altri simili; ma n’è oltre
ancora à Geografi, Cosmografi, Architetti Civili, et
Militari, à Bombardieri, Soldati privati,
Capitani, Maestri di Campo, et à qual si Voglia
altra persona Virtuosa.
title_EN:
Practical Geometry

Drawn from the Elements of Euclid
and other Authors,
described by Giovanni Pomodoro of Venice,
most excellent mathematician,
and explained by Giovanni Scala, mathematician.

In which are shown in 150 copperplate engravings only those things which a good Geometer ought to know and put to use.

A work no less useful than necessary for surveyors of land, of buildings, and the like; and further for geographers, cosmographers, civil and military architects, artillerymen, private soldiers, captains, field marshals, and for any other person of learning.

by Jacques Androuet du Cerceau.

on seigneurial estates with their particular conveniences: also gardens and orchards.

Very useful and necessary for those
who wish to build, so that they may be instructed and
understand the costs and expenses that must be made.

title:
DELLA
FORTIFICATIONE
DELLE CITTÀ,

DI M. GIROLAMO MAGGI, E DEL
CAPITAN IACOMO CASTRIOTTO,
Ingegniero del Christianiss. Re di Francia,
LIBRI III.

Ne’ quali, oltre le molte inventioni di questi Autori, si contiene tutto quello di più importanza, che sino
ad hora è stato scritto di questa materia; con infinite cose, che da molti Signori, Capitani,
& Ingegneri dell’età nostra si sono hauute.

Discorso del medesimo Maggi sopra la Fortificatione de gli alloggiamenti de gli esserciti.
Discorso del Capitan Francesco Montemellino sopra la fortificatione del Borgo di Roma.
Trattato dell’Ordinanze, & nero Battaglie del Capitan Giovacchino da Coniano.
Ragionamento del sudetto Castriotto sopra le fortezze della Francia.

CON PRIVILEGIO.
title_EN:
On the Fortification of Cities,

By Girolamo Maggi, and Captain Jacomo Castriotto,
Engineer to the Most Christian King of France,
In Three Books.

In which, besides the many inventions of these authors, is contained everything of greatest importance that has been written on this subject up to now; together with countless matters contributed by many lords, captains, and engineers of our own age.

Discourse by Maggi on the fortification of army encampments.
Discourse by Captain Francesco Montemellino on the fortification of the Borgo of Rome.
Treatise on the Ordinances and Order of Battle by Captain Giovacchino da Coniano.
Discourse by the aforesaid Castriotto on the fortresses of France.

With privilege.

title:
VANDEN CIRCKEL.
Daer in gheleert werdt te vinden de
naeste proportie des Circkels diameter tegen sijnen Omtloop, daertoe,
door alle Circkels (met alle Figuren, ofte Landen met cromme Linien besloten) recht
ghemeten kunnen werden. Item aller Figuren-siden in den Circkel bescheyden,
Beginnende van den 3/4/5/15 hoeck/in Irrationale ghetallen te brengen,
al hadde de Figueren veel bysonder-duysent hoecken. Item des
7/11/13/17/19/23 hoecx’ syden/ ende wat syden ofte
coorden men begeert / welcker Boge groot zijn
Graden / Minuten / Seconden / &c.
Naer elcx’ behaghen.

Noch de Tafelen Sinvvm, Tangentivm, ende Secantivm, met
het gebruyck van dien, hoogh-noodigh voor de Land-meters: Met veel an­
dere konstighe stucken, dierghelijcke noyt in druck uutghegheven.

Ten laetsten van Intrest / met alderhande Tafelen daertoe dienende / met het gheheym / doot veel constighe Exempelen gheleert / ende door ’t gheheele werck bewezen ende gheproeft.

Alles door Ludolph van Ceulen, gheboren in Hildesheim,
beschreven, ende inden druck ghebracht.
title_EN:
On the Circle.
In which is taught how to find the
nearest proportion of the circle’s diameter to its circumference, so that
all circles (with all figures, or lands enclosed with curved lines) can be exactly
measured. Also, the division of all figures within the circle,
beginning with the triangle, square, pentagon, and 15-gon, into irrational numbers,
even should the figure have many — a thousand — sides. Also of the
7, 11, 13, 17, 19, 23-sided figures, and whatever sides or
chords one desires, with their arcs expressed in
degrees, minutes, seconds, etc.,
as one pleases.

Also the tables of Sines, Tangents, and Secants, with
their use, most necessary for land-surveyors: with many other
artful things, never before printed.

Finally, on interest, with all sorts of tables serving thereto, / with its secret, taught with many clever examples, / and throughout the work demonstrated and proved.

All written and brought to print by Ludolph van Ceulen,
born in Hildesheim.

title:
Vsage.
ET DESCRIPTION
DE L’HOLOMETRE.

POUR SCAVOIR MESVRER
toutes choses qui sont soubs l’estanduë de
l’œil: Tant en longueur & largeur, qu’en hau­
teur & profondeur. Inuenté par Abel Foulon
Vallet de chambre du Roy.

Necessaire a ceus qui veulent promptement,
& sans aucune subiection d’Arithmetique,
sçauoir la distance des places, Arpanter ter­
re, & faire Cartes topographiques.
title_EN:
Use
and Description
of the Holometer.

To know how to measure
all things that are under the reach of
the eye: in length and breadth, as well as in
height and depth. Invented by Abel Foulon,
Valet de chambre to the King.

Necessary for those who wish promptly,
and without any dependence on arithmetic,
to know the distance of places, survey land,
and make topographical maps.

title:
DE
HOLOMETRI
FABRICA ET
VSU INSTRV
MENTO GEO
METRICO

Olim ab Abele Fullonio apud Henricum I I. Galliæ regem inuento:
nunc verò Io. Nicol. Stupani Philosophi & Medici opera, sermone la
tino ita explicato, vt ad omnis generis dimensiones inue
stigandas, & regiones describendas utilissi
mum simul & facillimum
esse queat.

Accessit Federici Delphini, clariss. olim apud Patavinos Mathe
matici, secundus disputatio de Aestu Maris, & mo
tu octauæ sphaeræ.

AD
Generosum & Magnificum D. D. Ioannem Oſ
molsky de Prawiedunky Po
lonum.
title_EN:
On the Construction and Use
of the Geometric Instrument
called the Holometer.

Formerly invented by Abel Foullon at the court of King Henry II of France,
now explained in the Latin tongue by the work of Johann Nikolaus Stupanus,
philosopher and physician, so that it may serve in the investigation of
all kinds of measurements and in the description of regions,
being most useful and easy at once.

Together with a treatise by the most renowned Federico Delfino,
formerly mathematician at Padua, on the Tides of the Sea
and on the motion of the eighth sphere.

Dedicated to the noble and magnificent
Johann Osmolsky of Prawiedunky, Pole.
imprint:
BASILEAE,
PER PETRVM PERNAM.
1577.

title:
FORTIFICATIONS
DV CHEVALIER
ANTOINE DE VILLE,

CONTENANS
LA MANIERE DE FORTIFIER TOVTE SORTE DE PLACES
tant regulierement, qu’irregulierement en quelle assiete qu’elles soient; comme
aussi les Ponts, passages, entrées de rivières, Ports de mer: La construction de
toutes sortes de Forts & Citadelles; le moyen facile de tracer sur le terrain. Le tout
à la moderne, comme il se pratique dans les meilleures Places de l’Europe, de
monstré & calculé par les Sinus & Logarithmes.

AVEC L’ATTAQVE, ET LES MOYENS DE PRENDRE LES PLACES
par intelligence, sédition, surprise, stratageme, escalade: Les effets de diverses sortes de Petards, pour
faire sauter les portes, murailles & bâtiments: Plusieurs Instrumens pour rompre les chaînes & passaux.
L’ordre des longs Sièges, la construction des Forts & Redoutes, les Retrenchemens des Quartiers,
Des Tranchées, Batteries, Mantelets, Mines, & plusieurs inventions nouvelles non iamais écrites.

Plus la Défense, & l’instruction generale pour s’empêcher des surprises: les remedes contre
la trahison, sédition, revolte: Pour se garantir des escalades: Diverses inventions nouvelles
contre le Petard: La defense contre les longs Sièges, & contre les Sièges par
force: L’ordre contre les approches: Des Sorties, Contre-mines,
Retrenchemens, Capitulation, & Reddition des Places.

Le tout representé en cinquante-cinq Planches, avec leurs Plantes, Profils, Estimations, & Paisages. Le Discours
est prouvé par Demonstrations, experiences, raisons communes, & physiques,
avec les rapports des Histoires anciennes, & modernes.
title_EN:
Fortifications
by Chevalier
Antoine de Ville,

Containing
The Method of Fortifying Every Kind of Place,
whether regularly or irregularly, in whatever position they may be; also bridges, passages, river entrances, seaports; the construction of all sorts of forts and citadels; the easy method of laying them out on the ground. All done according to the modern practice of the best fortresses of Europe, demonstrated and calculated by sines and logarithms.

With the Attack, and the Means of Taking Fortresses,
by intelligence, sedition, surprise, stratagem, escalade; the effects of various kinds of petards to blow up gates, walls, and buildings; various instruments for breaking chains and barriers. The order of long sieges, the construction of forts and redoubts, the entrenchment of quarters, trenches, batteries, mantelets, mines, and many new inventions never before written.

Also, the Defense, and general instruction for preventing surprise; remedies against treason, sedition, revolt; protection against escalade; new inventions against petards; defense against long sieges and sieges by force; the order of counter-approaches; sallies, countermines, retrenchments, capitulation, and surrender of places.

The whole represented in fifty-five plates, with their plans, profiles, elevations, and landscapes. The discourse is supported by demonstrations, experiments, common and physical reasons, and by the accounts of ancient and modern histories.

title:
COSMOGRAPHIA
IN QUATVOR LIBROS
DISTRIBVTA,

SVMMO ORDINE, MIRAQ. FACILITATE,
ac brevitate ad Magnam Ptolemaei Mathematicam
Constructionem, ad universamque
Astrologiam instituens:

FRANCISCO BAROCIO, IACOBI FILIO,
PATRITIO VENETO
AVTORE.

Cum Praefatione eiusdem Authoris, in qua perfecta quidem Astro-
logiae Divisio, & enarratio Authorum illustrium, & voluminum
ab eis conscriptorum in singulis Astrologiae partibus habetur:
Ioannis de Sacrobosco vero 84 errores, & alij permulti suorum
expositorum, & sectatorii ostenduntur, rationibusq. redarguuntur.

Praecesserunt etiam quaedam Communia Mathematica, necnon Arithmetica,
& Geometrica principia, nonnullaeque Propositiones, de quibus in
suo opere saepe fit mentio: Ac demum locupletissimus
Index eorum, quae ipsa Cosmographia continentur.

Omnia nuper in hac secunda editione ab ipso Authore dili-
genter recognita, multisq; in locis aucta.
title_EN:
COSMOGRAPHY
DIVIDED INTO FOUR BOOKS,

With the highest order, wonderful ease,
and brevity, leading to the Great Mathematical
Construction of Ptolemy, and to the whole of
Astrology:

By FRANCESCO BAROCCI, son of Jacopo,
Venetian patrician,
Author.

With a Preface by the same Author, in which a complete division
of Astrology is given, and an account of illustrious Authors and the volumes
written by them in each part of Astrology is provided:
and in which 84 errors of John of Sacrobosco,
and very many more of his commentators and followers,
are exposed and refuted by arguments.

Also preceding are certain General Mathematical matters, as well as
Arithmetic and Geometric principles, and some Propositions,
which are often mentioned in the work; and finally a very full
Index of the things contained in the Cosmography itself.

All things in this second edition newly revised by the Author himself,
and in many places enlarged.
imprint: Venetijs, Gratiosus Perchacinus excudebat 1598.

title:
QVATTRO LIBRI
GEOMETRICI
DI SILVIO BELLI VICENTINO.
Il Primo del Misurare con la vista.

NEL QVALE S’INSEGNA, SENZA TRAVAGLIAR
con numeri, à misurar facilissimamente le distantie, l’altezze, & le
profondità con il Quadrato Geometrico, e con altri istrumenti,
de’ quali facilmente si può provedere con le Figure.

Si mostra ancora una bellissima via di ritrovare la profondità di qual si voglia
mare, & un modo industrioso di misurar il circuito di tutta la Terra.

GLI ALTRI TRE SONO DELLA
Proportione & Proportionalità comuni
passioni del Quanto.

Utili, & necessarij alla vera, & facile intelligentia dell’Arithmetica, della
Geometria, & di tutte le scientie & arti.

CON PRIVILEGIO.
title_EN:
FOUR BOOKS
OF GEOMETRY
BY SILVIO BELLI OF VICENZA.
The first on Measuring by sight.

In which is taught, without laboring
with numbers, how to very easily measure distances, heights, 
and depths with the Geometric Square and other instruments, 
of which examples are provided with Figures.

It also shows a most excellent method for finding the depth of any sea, 
and an ingenious way of measuring the circuit of the whole Earth.

THE OTHER THREE ARE ON
Proportion & Proportionality, common
properties of Quantity.

Useful and necessary for the true and easy understanding 
of Arithmetic, Geometry, and all the sciences and arts.

WITH PRIVILEGE.

title:
GEOMETRIE
PRATIQUE,
Du Sr BOULENGER,
Lecteur ordinaire du Roy.

OU
Nouvelle Methode pour toiser & arpenter
promptement & facilement toutes sortes de
grandeurs, sans se servir de Fractions, de
Reductions, ny mêmes d’aucune Division,
quoy qu’on se serve de la mesure ordinaire
& de ses parties.

Ouvrage utile à tous Architectes, Ingenieurs, Maçons,
Arpenteurs, Taugeurs, & autres Geometres.

NOUVELLE EDITION,
Augmentée de plusieurs Notes, & d’un Traité de
l’Arithmetique par Geometrie.

Par Mr OZANAM, Professeur en
Mathematique.

PRACTICAL
GEOMETRY,
By Sieur Boulenger,
Ordinary Reader to the King.

OR
A new method to measure and survey
quickly and easily all kinds of magnitudes,
without using fractions, reductions,
nor even any division, using only ordinary
measurement and its parts.

A work useful to all Architects, Engineers, Masons,
Surveyors, Measurers, and other Geometers.

NEW EDITION,
Enlarged with several Notes, and with a Treatise on
Arithmetic by Geometry.

By Mr. Ozanam, Professor of
Mathematics.

title:
IO.
BVTEONIS DEL-

RVM TITVLI SE
QVVNTVR.

De arca Noe, cuius formæ, capacitatisq; fuerit.
De sublicio ponte Caesaris.
Confutatio quadraturæ circuli ab Orontio Finæo factæ.
Ad locum Quintiliani geometricum explanatio.
Ad problema cubi duplicandi.
Emendatio figurationis organi a Columella descripti.
De libra & statera.
De fluentis aquæ mensura.
De precio margaritarum.

IN IVRE CIVILI,

De fluviaticis Insulis secundum Ius civile diuidendis. vbi confutatur

De diuisione fructus arboris in confinio natæ.

Ad legem Papiniani, Divortio.
Ad legem Iuliani, Sitta scriptum.
Ad legem Aphricani, Qui quadringerta.
title_EN:
JOANNES BUTEON,
of Dauphiné,
GEOMETRICAL WORKS,
whose titles follow:

On Noah’s Ark: its form and capacity.
On Caesar’s wooden bridge.
Refutation of the quadrature of the circle made by Oronce Finé.
Explanation of the geometric passage in Quintilian.
On the problem of doubling the cube.
Correction of the device described by Columella.
On the balance and the steelyard.
On the measurement of flowing water.
On the price of pearls.

IN CIVIL LAW:

On river islands to be divided according to civil law, 
in which Bartolus of Tiberia is refuted.
On the division of the fruit of a tree growing on a boundary.
On the necessity of knowledge of geometry for a jurist.
On the law of Papinian, Divorce.
On the law of Julian, “Thus it is written.”
On the law of Africanus, “Who four hundred…”

IOAN. BVTEONIS

TRICA,

Qvorum titvli seqvntvr.

Confutatio quadraturæ circuli ab Orontio Finæo factæ.

title:
LE DVE
PRIME PARTI

GEOMETRIA
FAMIGLIARE

CAPRA
ARCHITETTO CREMONESE.

Ristampate dall’istesso Autore, & accre-
scìute nella prima parte di molti auer-
timenti necessarij à patroni delle fa-
briche, acciò si faccino con minor
spesa, & utile grandissimo.
Nella seconda si danno le misure
geometriche per misurare le
fabriche,
Con l’aggiunta dell’usiaggi de’ sienì so-
pra delle Cassine, e la regola da mi-
surarli, con la tavola delle cose
più notabili.

Dedicate agl’Illustriss. Signori
DECVRIONI

FIRST PARTS
OF

BY ALESSANDRO
CAPRA
ARCHITECT OF CREMONA.

Reprinted by the same Author, and en-
larged in the first part with many
necessary instructions for patrons of
buildings, so that they may be made
with less expense, and with very great utility.
In the second are given the geometric
measurements for measuring
buildings,
With the addition of surveys of barns
and farmhouses, and the rule for
measuring them, with a table of the
most notable things.

Dedicated to the Most Illustrious Lords

title:
FABRICA ET USO
Del Compasso di Proportione,

Dove insegna à gli ARTEFICI il modo di fare in esso
le necessarie diuisioni,

E con varij Problemi vsuali mostra l’vtilità
di questo Stromento,

PAOLO CASATI
DELLA COMPAGNIA DI GIESU,

Dando le ragioni, & apportando le dimostrazioni di tutte le
operationi nella Fabrica, e nell’Vso.

OPERA UTILE
Non solo à Geometri, Agrimensori, Architetti ciuili, e militari, Pittori, Scultori,
& à tutti quelli, che vsano del Disegno, mà anche à Bombardieri,
Sergenti di Battaglia, Mercanti, & altri, per molte operationi
Aritmetiche, fatte con grandissima facilità.

Accresciuta notabilmente in questa Seconda Editione dal medesimo Autore.
title_EN:
FABRICATION AND USE
Of the Proportional Compass,

Where it teaches ARTISANS the method of making with it
the necessary divisions,

And with various practical problems shows the usefulness
of this Instrument,

BY PAOLO CASATI
OF THE SOCIETY OF JESUS,

Giving the reasons, and providing demonstrations of all
the operations in its Construction and in its Use.

A USEFUL WORK
Not only for geometers, surveyors, civil and military architects, painters, sculptors,
and all those who use drawing, but also for gunners,
battle sergeants, merchants, and others, for many arithmetic
operations, carried out with great ease.

Greatly enlarged in this Second Edition by the same Author.
imprint: IN BOLOGNA, Per Gioseffo Longhi 1685. Con lic. de’ Superiori.

FABRICA, ET USO

DEL MOLTO REV. P. PAOLO CASATI

Dando le ragioni, & apportando le dimostrazioni di tutte

Agrimensori.

DI M. GIROLAMO CATANEO NOVARESE.
LIBRO PRIMO.

ON THE ART
OF MEASURING
TWO BOOKS,

In the first of which is taught
the measuring and
division of fields.

In the second, the measuring of walls,
the gauging of grain, wine, hay, and straw; 
the leveling of water, and other things necessary 
for surveyors.

BY MASTER GIROLAMO CATANEO OF NOVARA.

DELL’ARTE
DEL MISURARE
DI M. GIROLIAMO CATANEO

LIBRI DVE,

Con una nuova aggiunta di molte Figure, & dichiarationi

Nel Secondo à misurar le muraglie, imbottar Grani,
Vini, Fieni, & Strami; co’l liuellar l’Acque,
& altre cose necessarie à gli Agrimensori.

LIBRO PRIMO.

ON THE ART
OF MEASURING
BY MASTER GIROLAMO CATANEO
OF NOVARA.

TWO BOOKS,

In the first is taught how to measure and divide fields;

With a new addition of many Figures, and explanations
very useful, not previously printed in this book;

In the second, how to measure walls, to gauge grain,
wine, hay, and straw; to level water,
and other things necessary for surveyors.

FIRST BOOK.

LA

UNIVERSAL PRACTICE

fessor and Ordinary Lecturer in Mathematics, at

To the high and mighty Lord Messire Anné d’Anglu-

and Giury in Argonne, Beauvais, Nesle, Aygreuille,

title:
Libro di Arithmetica & Geometria
Speculatiua & praticale: Composto per maestro
Francesco Feliciano da Lazisio Terrone:
& Intitulato Scala Grimaldelli:
Nuouamente Stampato.

Chi vol aprir vna serraglia forte
In cima d’vna Torre ouer Castello
Bisogna hauer la Scala atto di quello
Giunger si possa alle serrate porte
A presso fa mestier l’huom seco porte
(Non hauendo la Chiave del sugello)
vn ferro che appellato e Grimaldello
Si non d’aprir l’imprese sue sien corte
Tal questo mio libretto mostra come
Sagliir si possa alla scerte serrature
Et quelle aprir senza fatica graue,
Infinite ragion, ponti, & misure
Questo chiarisce con modo suaue
Cui scale & Grimaldello il proprio nome.

Ma non lodar mie come
Col tuo lieto biasmar, che’l biasmo nasce
Sol de cui nel dir s’allegra e pasce.
title_EN:
Book of Arithmetic & Geometry
Speculative and practical: Composed by master
Francesco Feliciano of Lazisio Terrone:
And entitled The Ladder of the Picklock:
Newly Printed.

Whoever wishes to open a strong lock
At the top of a Tower or a Castle
Must have the Ladder suited to that,
So that he may reach the locked doors.
Then he must also carry with him
(If he does not have the Key of the seal)
An iron tool called the Picklock,
Otherwise his efforts will be in vain.
So too this little book of mine shows
How one may climb to certain locks
And open them without heavy labor:
Infinite reasons, bridges, and measures
It clarifies with gentle method,
To which the Ladder and the Picklock give their name.

But do not praise me thus,
Rather with your joyful blame—for blame is born
Only of him who in speaking delights and feeds upon it.
imprint: M. D. LXIII.

title:
SCALA
GRIMALDELLI
LIBRO DI
ARITMETICA, E GEOMETRIA
Speculatiua, e Pratticale
DI M. FRANCESCO FELICIANO
VERONESE.

DIVISO IN TRE LIBRI.

Nel primo si tratta di cose pertinenti a Mercatanti, & a qualunque altra
persona, cioè, numerar, rileuar, summar, sottrar, multiplicar, e partir,
con tutte le sue circostanze.

Nel secondo si tratta dell’Arte Maggiore di Algebra, cioè della regola
della cosa, censi, e cubi, con tutte le sue parti.

Accresciuto in quest’ultima Impressione di dottissimi Problemi da B. B.
Nel terzo, & ultimo si dimostra il misurar della Terra, Muri, Fieni,
Biave, Vini, Pietre, & iuuicar Acque, & ogn’altra cosa.

Di nuovo riuisto, & da molti errori corretto, & accresciuto di molte cose da
M. FILIPPO MACARIO Veronese Rasonato publico della Magnifica
Città. Con l’aggiunta della Regola del Catain del medesimo.

AL MOLT’ ILLUSTRE SIGNOR
GIO: BATTISTA SORER.
title_EN:
THE
PICKLOCK LADDER
BOOK OF
ARITHMETIC, AND GEOMETRY
Speculative and Practical
BY MASTER FRANCESCO FELICIANO
OF VERONA.

DIVIDED INTO THREE BOOKS.

In the first are treated matters pertinent to Merchants, and to any other
person, namely: numbering, recording, adding, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing,
with all their circumstances.

In the second is treated the Greater Art of Algebra, that is, the rule
of the thing, the square, and the cube, with all its parts.

In this last edition it is enriched with very learned Problems by B. B.
In the third, and last, is demonstrated the measurement of Land, Walls, Hay,
Grain, Wine, Stones, and the gauging of Waters, and every other thing.

Newly revised, corrected of many errors, and enriched with many additions by
M. FILIPPO MACARIO of Verona, Public Lecturer of the Magnificent
City. With the addition of the Rule of the Chain by the same.

TO THE MOST ILLUSTRIOUS LORD
GIOVANNI BATTISTA SORER.
imprint:
VENETIA MDCXCII.

Presso Gio: Giacomo Hertz.
CON LICENZA DE’ SUPERIORI.
imprint_EN:
VENICE 1692.

Printed by Gio: Giacomo Hertz.
WITH LICENSE OF THE SUPERIORS.

title:
PRATICA
D’ARITHMETICA
E GEOMETRIA,

NUOVAMENTE POSTA IN LVCE
Dal R. P. F. Lorenzo Forestani da Pescia,

De Minori conventuali di S. Franc. nella qual si dimostra un ve-
ro, & facilissimo modo da risolver ogni sorte di ragioni,

Da misurar tutte le superficie terrene, e corpi regolari, da misurar
con l’aspetto le distanze, l’altezze, e le profondità,

Con il modo da leuar le piante senza bussola: si copronsi in essa alcuni
errori di certi Autori.

Opera veramente non men’vile, che necessaria a gli studio-
si di tali scienze.

CON PRIVILEGI.
title_EN:
PRACTICE
OF ARITHMETIC
AND GEOMETRY,

Newly Brought to Light
By the Reverend Father Lorenzo Forestani of Pescia,

Of the Minor Conventuals of St. Francis. In which is demonstrated a true
and most easy method of resolving every sort of problems,

For measuring all terrestrial surfaces and regular bodies, for measuring
by sight distances, heights, and depths,

With the method of surveying land without a compass: in which are corrected
certain errors of other Authors.

A work truly not less useful than necessary to the students
of such sciences.

WITH PRIVILEGE.
imprint:
IN VENETIA, Appresso Georgio Varisco. M.DC.III.
Con Licentia de’ Superiori.

title:
Neue und Gründliche
Mathematische
Friedens-
und
Kriegs=Schule/
Worinnen
Der Kern und die nothwendigsten Stücke
der Sechs
Nachfolgenden Wissenschafften/
Als:
GEOMETRIÆ THEORETICÆ, der Erdmeß-
Kunst.
ARCHITECTURÆ CIVILIS, der Bürgerli-
chen Bau=Kunst.
ARCHITECTURÆ MILITARIS, der Forti-
fication oder Kriegs=Bau=Kunst.
ARTIS TORMENTARIÆ, der Artillerie oder
Büchsen=Meisteren.
PYROTECHNIÆ DAMNOSÆ, des Ernst=
Feuer=Wercks.
Und dann
PYROTECHNIÆ JUCUNDÆ, des Lust=
Feuer=Wercks/

Aus vielen/sowol alten/ als neuen berühm-
ten und bewährten Autoren zu jedermanns nütz-
lichen Gebrauch/mit gehörigen Figuren/kürzlich/ordent-
lich und deutlich aufgesetzt und zusammen getra-
gen durch
Joh. Sebastian Grubern, Majorn.
title_EN:
New and Thorough
Mathematical
School of Peace
and War,
Wherein
are contained the essence and the most necessary parts
of the six
following sciences:
Namely:

THEORETICAL GEOMETRY, the science of land-measuring.
CIVIL ARCHITECTURE, civic building.
MILITARY ARCHITECTURE, fortification or military construction.
THE ART OF GUNNERY, artillery or the mastery of firearms.
HARMFUL PYROTECHNICS, serious (military) fireworks.
And then
PLEASANT PYROTECHNICS, recreational fireworks.

Collected and set forth for general use from many renowned
and reliable authors, both old and new, with appropriate figures,
briefly, orderly, and clearly composed and compiled by
Johann Sebastian Gruber, Major.
imprint: Nürnberg/verlegts Christoph Riegel. An. 1697.
imprint_EN: Nuremberg, published by Christoph Riegel, Anno 1697.

title:
MODO
DI MISVRARE
LE FABRICHE
DI
D. GVARINO GVARINI C. R.
TEATINO MATEM:
DI
S. A. R.

In cui non vi è corpo, e quasi non vi
è superficie, purche godi di qualche
regolarità, che matematicamente
non resti misurato, riducendosi
à calcoli facilissimi anche quei
piani, e quei corpi, di cui
sin hora non è stato dato
modo, che li misuri.
title_EN:
METHOD
OF MEASURING
BUILDINGS
BY
DON GUARINO GUARINI, C.R.
THEATINE MATHEMATICIAN
OF
HIS ROYAL HIGHNESS.

In which there is no body, and almost no
surface, provided it possesses some
regularity, that is not measured mathematically,
reducing to very easy calculations even those
planes and those bodies for which
until now no method
of measurement has been given.

title:
Erster Tractat
Der Mechanischen Instrumenten
LEVINI HVLSII.

Gründtlicher / Augenscheinlicher Bericht deß newen Geome=
trischen Gruntmeßenden Instruments / Planimetra ge=
nannt / mit seinem Inductorio vnnd Rahmen. Sampt deß Qua=
drats vnd Quadrans auff vnerley ardt. Damit man mit sonderlichem
Vortheil / ein stück Landtschafft dem Augenschein / Statt / Vestung / äcker
oder die Gründtfläche ins Beldt absehen / auff’s Papier reissen vnnd Arcam
oder die Grösse desselben finden kan. Item alle Höhe / Weite /
Länge vnnd Lufft-Abstãndt messen.
title_EN:
First Treatise
Of Mechanical Instruments
by Levinus Hulsius.

Thorough / Evident Report of the new Geome=
trical Ground-Measuring Instrument / called Planimetra /
with its Inductorium and Frame. Together with the Square /
and Quadrant in various kinds. By which one can with special
advantage / survey a piece of landscape by sight / city / fortress / fields
or the ground surface in picture / draw it on paper and determine
its area or size. Likewise to measure all heights / widths /
lengths and air-distances.

title_EN:
A COMPREHENSIVE SYSTEM
OF THE WHOLE OF
MATHEMATICS,
that is
GEOMETRY,
OPTICS, ASTRONOMY,
AND
GEOGRAPHY

Presented in public lectures in the year 1605
at the most celebrated Gymnasium of Danzig.

By
BARTHOLOMÆUS KECKERMANN,
Licentiate of Sacred Theology and
Professor of Philosophy

At the end is added a brief Nautical Commentary,
by the same author, presented there in the year 1603.

With an index of the chapters of each book.
Finally, so that the book might become a complete Course
of Mathematics,
is added also a very brief Introduction to Geography.

Likewise, an easy Method of Practical Arithmetic
by Gemma Frisius.

title:
NINE
GEOMETRICALL
EXERCISES,
FOR
Young Sea-men,
And others that are studious in
MATHEMATICALL PRACTICES:

Containing IX particular TREATISES,
whose Contents follow in the next Pages.

All which EXERCISES are Geometrically performed, by
a Line of chords and equal Parts, by waies not usually
known or practised. Unto which the Analogies or Proportions
are added, whereby they may be applied to the Chiliads of
Logarithms, and Canons of Artificial Sines and Tangents.

By William Leybourn, Philomath.
title_EN:
Nine Geometrical Exercises,
for Young Seamen,
and others who are studious in
Mathematical Practices:

Containing nine particular treatises,
whose contents are listed in the following pages.

All these exercises are geometrically performed by
a line of chords and equal parts, by methods not usually
known or practiced. To these are added analogies or proportions,
by which they may be applied to the chiliads of
logarithms, and the canons of artificial sines and tangents.

By William Leybourn, Philomath.
