title:
Cursus Mathematicus:
MATHEMATICAL
SCIENCES,
In Nine BOOKS.

Comprehending

ARITHMETICK,
  Vulgar, }{ Instrumental,
  Decimal, }{ Algebraical.

GEOMETRY,
  Plain, }{ Solid.

COSMOGRAPHY,
  Celestial, }{ Terrestrial.

ASTRONOMY,
  Theorical, }{ Practical.

NAVIGATION,
  Plain, }{ Spherical.

TRIGONOMETRY,
  Rectilinear, }{ Circular.

WITH THE
Description, Construction, and Use of Geometrical and Nautical
INSTRUMENTS:

AND
The Doctrine of TRIANGLES applied to Practice in
MENSURATIONS of all kinds:

AS IN
Longimetria, 
Planometria,
Military Architecture,
Or }{
Taking of Heights, Distances, &c.
Surveying of Land, Woods, Roads, &c.
Fortification.

And in Navigation, Dialling, &c.

All which are disposed in such Method and Order as they ought to be Read and 
Practised, by such as would attain to a competent Proficiency in 
them by their own Industry.

By WILLIAM LEYBOURN, Philomath.

Nil tam difficile est quod non Solertia vincat.
title_EN:
Cursus Mathematicus: Mathematical Sciences in Nine Books.
Comprising:  
– Arithmetick (Vulgar, Instrumental, Decimal, Algebraical)  
– Geometry (Plain, Solid)  
– Cosmography (Celestial, Terrestrial)  
– Astronomy (Theoretical, Practical)  
– Navigation (Plain, Spherical)  
– Trigonometry (Rectilinear, Circular)  

With the description, construction, and use of geometrical and nautical instruments;  
and the doctrine of triangles applied to practice in mensurations of all kinds,  
such as longimetry, planometry, and military architecture (taking of heights, distances,  
surveying of land, woods, roads, fortification), and also in navigation, dialling, etc.  

Arranged in such method and order as they ought to be read and practiced, by those who would  
attain to a competent proficiency in them by their own industry.  

By William Leybourn, Philomath.  

“Motto: Nil tam difficile est quod non solertia vincat”  
(Nothing is so difficult that skill cannot overcome it).
imprint:
LONDON,
Printed for Thomas Bassett, Benjamin Tooke, Thomas Sawbridge,
Anthony and John Churchill. MDCXC.

title:
PRATICA
VNIVERSALE
facilissima, et breve
di misurare con la vista.
PARTE PRIMA.

doue si insegna il modo di
misurare qual si voglia lunghezza,
larghezza, altezza, ò profondità
separatamente, et unitamente
per strauagante, et lontana
che sia, in una sola operatione:
cioè, non si partendo dal luogo.

DI
GIUSEPPE MALOMBRA
NOBILE CREMONESE
title_EN:
UNIVERSAL PRACTICE,
very easy and brief,
of measuring by sight.
FIRST PART.

Where is taught the method of
measuring any desired length,
width, height, or depth,
separately and together,
however irregular or distant
it may be, in a single operation:
that is, without leaving the spot.

BY
GIUSEPPE MALOMBRA,
Nobleman of Cremona

title:
MANVALE
Arithmeticae & Geometriae Practicae

In het welcke
Beneffens de Stock-rekenninghe ofte
Rabdologia J. Nepperi, cortelick en duydelick t’ge-
ne den Landmeters en Ingenieurs, nopende ’t land-
meten en Sterkten-bouwen nootwendich is, wort
geleert ende exemplaerlick aengewesen.

Op een nieu verrijckt met een nieuwe inventie om alle ronde
vatten hare wanhgheden af te pegelen.

Door
Adrianum Metium Med. D. & Ma-
thes. Profess. ordin. binnen Franeker.
title_EN:
MANUAL
of Practical Arithmetic and Geometry

In which,
along with the Rod-calculation or
Rabdology of J. Napier, briefly and clearly that
which is necessary for Land-Surveyors and Engineers,
concerning land-measuring and fortification-building,
is taught and illustrated by examples.

Newly enriched with a new invention for gauging
all round vessels as to their capacities.

By
Adriaan Metius, Doctor of Medicine and
Professor of Mathematics at Franeker.
imprint:
Tot Amsterdam,

title:
CLAVIS MATHEMATICA
denuò LIMATA,
Sive potius
FABRICATA.

Cui accedit
Tractatus de Resolutione Æquatio-
num qualitercunque adfectarum
in numeris:

Et
Declaratio tum decimi elementi Euclidis
de lateribus incommensurabilibus: tum
decimi tertii & decimi quarti ele-
menti de quinque solidis
Regularibus.

Atque hic passim
Logistica decimalis, & Logarithmorum
Doctrina intexitur.

Authore Gulielmo Oughtredo Anglo.
title_EN:
THE MATHEMATICAL KEY,
again revised,
or rather
RECONSTRUCTED.

To which is added
a Treatise on the Resolution of Equations
of whatever form,
in numbers:

And
an Explanation both of the tenth element of Euclid
concerning incommensurable magnitudes,
and of the thirteenth and fourteenth elements
concerning the five regular solids.

And here throughout
is interwoven the doctrine of Decimal Arithmetic
and of Logarithms.

By William Oughtred, Englishman.
imprint:
LONDINI;

Del Sig. Gio. Francesco Peverone di Cuneo.

title:
LA GEOMETRIA
PRATTICA
DI GIO. POMODORO
VENETIANO

Cauata da gli elementi d’Euclide, d’altri
famosi Autori.

Con l’espositione di GIO. SCALA Matematico.

In cinquanta Tavole, scolpite in Rame,
dalle quali con facilità possono apprendere
tutte le cose, che al buon Geometra
s’appartengono.

Opera necessaria à Matematici, ad Architetti, à Geografi,
à Cosmografi, à Bombardieri, à Ingegneri,
à Soldati, & à tutti gli studiosi d’essi.

DEDICATA
ALL’ILLUSTRISS. ET ECCELLENTISS.
SIG. PAOLO SAVELLO
Prencipe d’Albano, Consigliere di Stato,
Cameriere di S. M. Cesarea, et suo
Ambasciatore in Roma.
title_EN:
THE PRACTICAL
GEOMETRY
BY GIOVANNI POMODORO
VENETIAN

Drawn from the Elements of Euclid and of other
famous Authors.

With the exposition of GIOVANNI SCALA, Mathematician.

In fifty copper-engraved plates,
from which one may easily learn
all that pertains to the good Geometer.

A work necessary for Mathematicians, Architects, Geographers,
Cosmographers, Artillerymen, Engineers,
Soldiers, and all students of these arts.

DEDICATED
TO THE MOST ILLUSTRIOUS AND EXCELLENT
SIGNOR PAOLO SAVELLO,
Prince of Albano, Councillor of State,
Chamberlain to His Imperial Majesty, and his
Ambassador in Rome.

title:
The pathewaie to
knowledge, contaiynyng the fyrst
principles of Geometrie, as thei
maie moste aptly bee applied unto
practise, bothe for vse of instru-
mentes Geometricall, and A-
stronomicall: and also for
projection of plattes
in euery kinde,
and
therefore muche neces-
sarie for all sortes
of menne.

Geometries verditcte.

All freshe fine wittes by me are filed,
All grosse dull wittes wishe me exiled:
Though no mans witte reiect wil I,
Yet as thei bee, I will them trie.

1574
title_EN:
The pathway to
knowledge, containing the first
principles of Geometry, as they
may most aptly be applied unto
practice, both for the use of
Geometrical and Astronomical
instruments: and also for
the projection of maps
of every kind,
and
therefore very necessary
for all sorts
of men.

Geometry’s verdict:

All fresh fine wits by me are sharpened,
All gross dull wits wish me banished:
Though no man’s wit will I reject,
Yet as they are, I will them test.

1574

title:
Hexameron Geometricum,
OFTE
Nieuw Onderwijs
der Landt-Meterye:

Waer door yemandt, in den tijdt van
ses Dagen, de Landt-meterye, son-
der Reken-konst, genoegsaem en-
de seer lichtelijck kan leeren:

Zijnde hier achter noch tot een Aen-hanghsel
by-gevoegt, een corte Methode, Coherentiae ende
aen-een-hanginge der gantscher Theologie.

Door D. Anguilla Rosæo.
title_EN:
Hexameron Geometricum,
OR
New Instruction
in Land Surveying:

Whereby anyone, in the space of
six days, may sufficiently and
very easily learn land surveying,
without arithmetic.

Added hereafter also as an Appendix,
a short Method, of the Coherence and
interconnection of the whole of Theology.

By D. Anguilla Rosæo.
imprint:
TOT LEEUWARDEN,
Gedruckt by CLAUDE FONTEYNE, Ordi-
naris Landtschapts Boeck-Drücker. 1647.
imprint_EN:
At Leeuwarden,
Printed by Claude Fonteyne, Ordinary
Printer of the Provincial Estates’ Books. 1647.

title:
PRACTICAL
GEOMETRY,
In Two Parts:

The First, Shewing how to perform the
four Species of ARITHMETICK, (viz. Addition,
Substraction, Multiplication, and Division,)
Together with Reduction, and the
Rule of Proportion in
FIGURES.

The Second, Containing A Hundred
GEOMETRICALL QUESTIONS,
With their Solutions and Demonstrations, some of them
being performed Arithmetically, and others Geometri-
cally, yet all without the help of Algebra.

A Worke very necessary for all Men, but
principally for Surveyors of Land, Engineers, and all
other Students in the Mathematicks.

By Captain THOMAS RUDD, chief
Engineer to his late MAJESTY.
imprint:
LONDON:
Printed by ROBERT LEYBOURN, for Robert Boydell,
at the Bulwark neer the Tower: and Samuel Satterthwait, at
the Globe in Pauls Church-yard, neer the West end. 1650.

title:
GEOME-
TRIÆ PRACTICÆ
NOVÆ ET
AUCTÆ

Tractatus III.
MENSULA PRÆTORIANA,

Beschreibung deß nützlichen
Geometrischen Tischleins / von dem
fürtrefflichen und weitberühmten Ma-
thematico M. Johanne Praeto-
rio S. erfunden.

Allen / der hochnützlichen Geome-
triæ practicæ Liebhabern / zu sonderm Ehren
und wolgefallen / umbständiglich / ausführlich und
notwendig beschrieben / und zum andern
mal durchsehen und gemeh-
ret / durch
M. Danielem Schwenterum Profes-
sorem Altdorphinum, &c.
title_EN:
Practical Geometry,
New and Enlarged.

Treatise III.
The Praetorian Table,

A description of the useful
Geometrical Table, invented by the
excellent and widely renowned mathematician
Master Johannes Praetorius.

For all lovers of the most useful
practical geometry, for their special honor
and satisfaction, carefully, thoroughly, and
necessarily described, and for the second
time revised and enlarged
by
Master Daniel Schwenter,
Professor at Altdorf, etc.
imprint:
Nürnberg /
Gedruckt und verlegt durch Simon Halbmayern.
imprint_EN:
Nuremberg,
Printed and published by Simon Halbmayr.

title:
M. Daniel Schwenters
GEOMETRIÆ
PRACTICÆ
NOVÆ ET AUCTÆ
LIBRI IV.

Im I. Aus rechtem Fundament gewiesen wird; wie man in der
Geometria, auf dem Papyr und Lande, mit denen
dazu gehörigen Instrumenten, ja zur Noth ohne die-
selben, verfahren und practicien solle.

Im II. Wie ohne einig künstlich Geometrisch Instrument, allein
mit der Meßruthe und etlichen Stäben, das Land zu
messen.

Im III. Die Beschreibung deß nützlichen Geometrischen Tisch-
leins M. Johannis Pratorii.

Im IV. Die Erfindung Camillæ Ravertræ, aus einem Stand
das Land zu messen.

Allen Professionen, und insonderheit der Geometriæ
Liebhabern, von neuem an Tag gegeben, und mit vielen nütz-
lichen Additionen und neuen Figuren vermehrt
durch
GEORGIUM ANDREAM BÖCKLERN,
Architect, & Ingenieur.
title_EN:
M. Daniel Schwenter’s
Practical Geometry,
New and Enlarged,
In Four Books.

I. Showing from proper foundations how one ought to proceed
and practice in Geometry, both on paper and on land,
with the appropriate instruments, and in necessity even
without them.

II. How, without any artificial geometrical instrument,
but only with the measuring rod and some staffs,
to measure land.

III. A description of the useful geometrical table
of Master Johann Praetorius.

IV. The invention of Camilla Ravertra,
to measure land from a single position.

Now newly published for all professions,
and especially for lovers of geometry,
and enlarged with many useful additions
and new figures,
by
Georg Andreas Böckler,
Architect and Engineer.
imprint:
Nürnberg,
In Verlegung Johann Andreae Endters, und Wolfgang des-
selbigen Sel. Erben.
M. DC. LXVII.
imprint_EN:
Nuremberg,
Published by Johann Andrea Endter,
and Wolfgang Endter, his blessed heir.
1667.

title:
Het Eerste Deel
Van de
MATHEMATISCHE
VERMAECK-
LYCKHEDEN.

Te samen gevoeght
Van verscheyden geneughlycke en boertige
Werckstucken, soo uyt Arithmetica, Geometria,
Astronomia, Geographia, Cosmographia, Musica,
Physica, Optica, Catoptrica, Architectonica,
Scioterica, als uyt andere ongehoorde
Mysterien meer.

Getranslateert uyt Francoys in Nederduytsche Tale: En verrijckt, vermeerdert en verbeterd
met verscheyden Observationen en Annotationen,
dienende tot onderrichtinghe van eenige
duystere quaestien en mislagen in
den Franschen Druck.

DOOR
WYNANT van WESTEN,
Mathematicus der Stadt Nymegen.

Den sesten Druck, op nieuws Oversien, ende
van vele Druck-fauten verbeteret.
title_EN:
The First Part
of the
Mathematical
Amusements.

Collected
from various delightful and witty
works, taken from Arithmetic, Geometry,
Astronomy, Geography, Cosmography, Music,
Physics, Optics, Catoptrics, Architecture,
Scioterics (the study of shadows), as well as
many other unheard-of mysteries.

Translated from French into Dutch; and enriched, enlarged,
and improved with various observations and annotations,
serving for the instruction concerning certain
obscure questions and errors in
the French edition.

By
Wynant van Westen,
Mathematician of the City of Nijmegen.

The sixth edition, newly revised,
and corrected of many printing errors.

title:
Het eerste Deel
Van de
MATHEMATISCHE
VERMAECK-
LYCKHEDEN.

Te samen ghevoeght
Van verscheyden ghenuchtijcke ende boertige Werck-stucken, soo uyt
Arithmetica, Geometria, Astronomia, Geographia,
Cosmographia, Musica, Physica, Optica, Catoptrica,
Architectonica, Scioterica, als uyt andere
onghehoorde Mysterien
meer.

Ghetranslateert uyt het Fransch in Ne-
derduytsche tale: ende verrijckt, vermeerdert, ende
verbeteret met verscheyden Observationen ende Annotationen,
dienende tot onderrichtinghe van eenige duystere
quaestien, ende mis-slaghen inden Franschen druck.

Door
WYNANT van WESTEN,
Mathem. ende Organist der Stadt Niuemegen.

Den derden Drucx, op nieuws oversien ende verbetert.
title_EN:
The First Part
of the
Mathematical
Amusements.

Collected
from various delightful and witty works, taken from
Arithmetic, Geometry, Astronomy, Geography,
Cosmography, Music, Physics, Optics, Catoptrics,
Architecture, Scioterics (the study of shadows), as well as
many other unheard-of mysteries.

Translated from French into Dutch; and enriched, enlarged,
and improved with various observations and annotations,
serving for the instruction concerning certain obscure
questions and errors in the French edition.

By
Wynant van Westen,
Mathematician and Organist of the City of Nijmegen.

The third edition, newly revised and corrected.

1644

title:
LEXICON
MATHEMATICUM.
HOC EST
Rerum omnium ad universam planè Mathesim
quocunque modo, directè, vel indirectè
spectantium,
COLLECTIO, ET EXPLICATIO.

Continens Terminum, praesertim exoticorum, dilucidationem,
Nominis rationem, atque Etymologiam, Principia, Praecepta
communia, Axiomata, &c. ac brevem, & exactam
Doctrinae traditionem; additis, ubi opus est,
schematibus, ad pleniorem Tyronum
intelligentiam.

Ut non immerito
QUADRIVIUM SCIENTIARUM,
Ac totius MATHESIS PROMPTVARIVM dici possit.

AUTHORE
HIERONYMO VITALI
CLERICO REGULARI.
title_EN:
Mathematical Lexicon.
That is,
A collection and explanation
of all things that in any way, directly or indirectly,
pertain to the whole of mathematics.

Containing the clarification of terms, especially unusual ones,
the meaning of names and their etymology, principles,
general precepts, axioms, etc., and a brief yet exact
presentation of doctrine; with diagrams added
where needed, for the fuller understanding
of beginners.

So that it may rightly be called
The Quadrivium of the Sciences,
and the Compendium of the Whole of Mathematics.

By
Hieronymo Vitali,
Cleric Regular.
imprint:
ROMAE, TYPIS ET IMPENSIS IOSEPHI VANNACCI.
ANNO MDCXC.
SUPERIORUM PERMISSU.
imprint_EN:
Rome, Printed and published by Joseph Vannacci.
Year 1690.
With permission of the superiors.

title:
LEXICON
MATHEMATICUM
ASTRONOMICUM GEOMETRICUM,

Hoc est
Rerum omnium ad utramque immo & ad omnem
ferè Mathesim quomodocumque spectantium,
Collectio, & explicatio.

Adjectâ brevi novorum Theorematum expensione, verbo-
rumque exoticorum dilucidatione ut non injuriâ
Disciplinarum omnium Mathematicarum summa, &
Promptuarium dici possit.

Auctore HIERONYMO VITALI Capuano, Clerico Regulari,
vulgo Theatino.
title_EN:
Mathematical Lexicon,
Astronomical and Geometrical,

That is,
A collection and explanation of all things pertaining
to both, indeed to almost the whole of mathematics
in whatever way.

With a brief exposition of new theorems, and
an elucidation of unusual terms,
so that it may rightly be called
a compendium and storehouse of all mathematical disciplines.

By Hieronymo Vitali of Capua,
Cleric Regular, commonly called a Theatine.
